text: Our hotel room was rather disgusting.  The carpet is full of stains and the wallpaper is pealing off of the wall in the bathroom.  As you will see in one of my pictures they have a holder in the bathtub for decent size bottles of shampoo, conditioner and soap.  The holder locks which I assume is so that nobody can steal their products.  However, the soap wasn't in the locked container.  I guess that is so that their guests can carry that soap back and forth between the shower and the sink because that was the only soap in the room.  Also, the large bottle for conditioner was completely empty.  It seemed more like a $59.99 room instead of a $159 room.  Very disappointing.  Also, it is quite a long walk outside to get to the casino.  Luckily it was decent weather while we were there.

text:
Best RV Park in the area and closest to Chicago. + a Casino.
Check in is easy, You check in at the hotel. The Girls at the front desk are awesome, friendly, and knowledgeable of the area. During our stay RV Sites included free breakfast and $5 off coupons for food at the casino.
The sites are huge, grass everywhere,  and the area is well lit.
Partial hookups; Electric and Water with a nice dump station behind the hotel, easy access and clean.
The Casino has 3 great places to eat and live entertainment on various nights. Slots and Tables. We've had good luck at the slots. Haven't tried the tables.
There is a shuttle that doubles as security to take you to and from the casino.
And here's a cool plus,  evening visits by deer. yep there is a small herd that lives in the area and the wander through most evenings.

text: We went on a Monday night to celebrate a 21st birthday. We ate at 99 Hops House. All the dishes were really good, I had the chicken panini and it was full of flavor and really delicious. My dining companions had the pot roast sandwich, the burger, the BBQ chicken flatbread and the fish & chips. Everyone said their selection was really good. The service was great, they even brought a happy birthday slice of cheese cake to the guest of honor, we did not order or ask for this, it was a kind gesture from the establishment. Afterwards we went into the casino gaming area and we're happy to see it wasn't crowded on a Monday. This gave us an opportunity to learn different games and we especially had a great time at the craps table. The pit crew were really informative and helpful in learning the game, it was a tremendous experience and a lot of fun! It was a great birthday celebration and the welcoming staff made it feel even more special.

text:
I was excited to stay at this haunted hotel until I checked into the hotel. The lady at the check-in deck, didn't get her name, was upset and rude when I asked if I could stay in one of the haunted rooms. This is how our convo went:

Her response: "we don't have any. Because we aren't haunted."

My response: "oh that's not what I read online."

Her response: "Idk where you read that because this hotel isn't haunted."

Keep in mind she is saying this as a total Karen.

My response (joking tone): "weird. Better not tell you the website then (laugh.)"

Her response: "no you better go ahead and tell me the website so we can get it taken down. Tell me now. What is it?"

Me: "idk the website"

Her as I walk outside to get my bags from the car: grabs phone to probably look up website.

Overall, I loved the history of the hotel. Its a shame that they added a casino to the old Ball Room. Vintage is what's popular right now. The hotel is owned by the Silverado across the street, maybe keep the slot machines in the Silverado and restore the old Ball Room? People my age would dance and have a good time in the Ball Room to any music. Square Dancing, hip-hop, ect.

text: Wonderful historic hotel in Deadwood.  Comfortable rooms and superior dining.
title: Silverado Franklin Historic Hotel & Gaming Complex, Legends Steakhouse & Silverado Grand Buffet
prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion: Wonderful historic hotel in Deadwood.  Comfortable rooms and superior dining.

text:
Hotel rooms are not great. They have not been updated since the early 1900s. The room my family and I stayed in had 2 bedrooms and a kitchen room that had the sink drains covered with a sign saying " Do not use sink ". The bedrooms didn't have doors. The only bathroom was very small and was in the room with the two beds. The king bedroom used to have a bathroom but the door was locked with a table pushed up against it. In the entry room there was a big closet room where the king bathroom used to be,  which obviously was not useable. The entry door wouldn't lock. I had to stick a folded up card behind the door lock to make it latch properly. I was worried about a fire in the old building. I made sure I knew where the fire escapes were. One was out of a window in the main hallway that led to the fire escape stairway. Room left a lot of room for improvement.
The gambling hall was old but had some new remodeled bathrooms with gold bars and new tile.
The dining room downstairs was very nice. Newer design features with newer bathrooms too. Could get down to restaurant from the elevator.

text: Only went for the Grand Buffet. The food was pretty good, the service was fast, and  the interior was nice and had plenty of seating. I had been to another buffet across town earlier in the week and this one is definitely better. There were lots of options for both hot food and a salad bar. There weren't many options for desert. It loses a star because some of the food had been sitting in the buffet for a while and started to dry out, but this is understandable as it wasn't very crowded on a weekday. I would recommend this if someone is looking for a prime rib buffet in the deadwood area.

text:
I was very disappointed.  My stay lasted no more than 20 minutes.

When I arrived, the Clerk was disinterested.  I was told to park in the "school" parking lot.  What I was NOT told was that someone needed to be there to unlock the gate.  When I pulled up, the lot was locked.  I had to drive around the block to get back into the hotel, to inform the Clerk it was locked, for one of the bellboys to say someone needed to meet me out there to unlock the fence.  I then drove around the block again and was able to get into the parking lot.

Upon entering my hotel room, I was in disbelief.  I understand this is a historic building, but was surprised to find that to them, historic meant outdated, dingy, dirty, and simply un-maintained.

I rented a 2 bedroom suite.  The kitchen was in a room off of 1 bedroom, while the bathroom was in the other bedroom.  So, to use the restroom, you had to enter the other guest's room.  If you wanted to watch TV, you had to go into the bedroom with the kitchen.  The kitchen was outdated.  The kitchen sink did not have handles and was filthy.  The fridge didn't shut unless you slammed it.  I understand now why their website has minimal photos of their rooms.

There is no AC or central air.  The wall heaters were on when I arrived.  I turned them all off.  To cool my room, I opened the windows.  I was on the 4th floor and had no screen on my large windows.   A loose nail was just sitting on my window ledge.  I called down to the front desk and had them bring up 2 fans, which I put in my windows to attempt some form of cool air in my suite.

There were dead flies and bees on the floor, on the heating units, and in the windowsills.  A live grasshopper was on my bed.  Again.  I was on the 4th floor.

The bed in the room with the TV was broken.  When my guest sat on it, I truly thought she was going to flip off the bed as it sank so far down, so quickly.

After maybe 20 minutes total, I could no longer justify the extreme expense of my room ($630 for two nights).  When I went down to the Clerk, I asked for a manager, and she came up quickly.  I briefly explained my concerns and without hesitation, she said she would cancel my room.  While I was pleased with this resolution, it seemed odd that the immediate response was simply to remove me from the hotel rather than find a more acceptable room.  This leads me to believe this is a common occurrence.

Overall, I would give this hotel 0 stars if I could.  I've read other reviews of this hotel and am floored by those who had a pleasant stay.

text: Looks like a well maintained‚Äã golf course. It has a nice clubhouse and OK RV park for peaple traveling. I'm not a golfer but I stayed at the RV park.  I saw how well they kept up the golf course.  I stayed in the RV park for two months.  They did not seem good at managing the RV park and at times the management didn't know who was even there.  At times they didn't even dump the trash cans. They sometimes went days without doing this and only dumped them oafter they started overflowing. The golf course was well kept but there was lots of weeds around the RV spaces.  Electrical is included but daily space rates seem high for what they have to offer. This was NOT a dog friendly RV park. They have very poor WiFi service.  They had no laundry facilities.

completion: Went on a Tuesday which I think helped as lines weren‚Äôt too long! Lots of fun rides and definitely somewhere you can come to and leave at any point to shop!

text: The Shredder ride was probably the most intense. The SpongeBob coaster has that 90 degree drop, but it's so short you barely notice it. So, if you can handle the Shredder ride, you can handle any of the rest. Longest line of the day was the log flume ride...while it was fun, I didn't feel it was worth the wait.

text: We love Nickelodeon Universe!!!! They've got rides for toddlers, big kids and adults; face painting, caricatures, airbrush shirts. I've taken my kids multiple times and we all love it. Perfect anyday, especially if the weather outside is rainy/snowy/cold. Family friendly. Relatively clean environment. Nice selection of thrill and not so intimidating rides. I haven't experienced it, but they have a quiet/low stimulation room for those with autism as well. We went around Xmas and I was expecting crazy crowds. But it wasnt bad at all. There may be long lines for some rides but they move pretty fast. Most popular rides may have 30-40 minute wait times. There are places to sit and restrooms sprinkled throughout Nick Universe so you dont have to roam through the mall to find relief. Less crowded in the evenings after dinnertime. Wristbands allow all day access and wristband packages let you experience Nick Universal and other attractions like Sea World, Crayola Experience, mini golf, escape rooms, Fly Over America, etc. You can leave and come back to see the universe all lit up. It's a family favorite for us!!

text:
Thanks for the great stay Hyatt Eden!!  A group of us drove from Winnipeg to Minneapolis to catch a Vikings game. We were concerned this hotel was too far away but it didn‚Äôt turn out to be an issue. It‚Äôs easy enough to drive around the city. Maybe took us half hour to get downtown. The Harley store, Target and Menards are close to the hotel so that was nice.

The rooms are big!! King Bed comfy, shower pressure great and lots of hot water!!!  Pull out sofa.
Could have easily had 4 adts share the king room.

Front staff check in was pleasant. They didn‚Äôt realize we were all traveling together so they ended up placing us on different floors. But that was our fault for not speaking up.
We also didn‚Äôt speak up about having a room away from the elevators. It was annoying to be woken up super early from guests checking out and kids running up and down the hallway etc. By the elevator. Things yah just don‚Äôt think about sometimes.

We would all stay here again!!

text:
I stayed here for a few nights after a work trip so I could visit with family before the holidays. The room was nice, but needed some tlc. There were a few spots on the ceiling where the plaster was noticeably cracked and bubbled, as well as a large spot where it was missing. The curtain was also a tad stained.

Other than those small issues, everything else the room was in great condition. The room was well-cleaned and both the sofa and bed were comfortable. I generally prefer to stay at this location as it's quieter then staying near the airport. The staff here is also very friendly and accommodating, which is a huge plus for me.

text: Great beers & foodies & company
title: CityCade Classic Arcade and Pinball Game Bar, Gastonia NC
prompt: A Google Maps review about a bar.
completion: Great beers & foodies & company

text:
I finally got a chance to check this place out. Most of the barcades are in Charlotte so it's nice to have one close to home. I went on a Thursday night which is "guys night" and was welcomed as soon as I walked in, both the owners and the guests were very friendly. For Thursdays, about all games were free (at least for dudes) except for pinball, which were .50 a game. Normally it's $5 a person for unlimited play and pinball is $1.00 a game (ouch to $1.00 pinball!). There were maybe 6 to 12 people rotating in and out while I was there, so not crowded at all. Parking was abundant. It's about a 5 minute walk from Freeman's. Bar can turn cash to quarters or can give you quarters from your bar tab for a 10% surcharge. Bar had food and drinks at fair prices. There are 2 gender neutral restrooms. There are a few TV's playing sports and comic book movies and YouTube videos. Place was open until midnight on a weeknight which was cool. There was one tv hooked up to a Nintendo 64 with a pretty large assortment of games. There were a couple party/board games sitting near a table. There was a fairly large area for outdoor seating as well. I think what made this visit special was how friendly the owners and guests were, felt like you were just visiting old friends instead of strangers.

EDIT: Citycade did a reconfiguration and brought in a racing game, a shooting game, a beer pong game and a couple of pay to win games disguised as games of skill. I believe at this point they've gotten rid of the $5 cover entirely and just made the machines take quarters, which I think was a good move. Pinball is still a buck which is a bummer since there are better options out there for $.50 a game, but it's close to home at least and the price point isn't uncommon. Pinball seems maintained and Citycade has occasionally swapped out for different pins, which is nice. Bathrooms are always clean which is a plus. Only complaint is that sometimes it can get a bit hot in the building.

text:
We have lived in NC for 8 years and I wish we had discovered this place sooner!! This museum is fantastic for all ages.

From the life-size dinosaurs to the tiny creepy crawlers, my kids were engaged and eager to learn at every turn.

We came during a free Duke Energy Tuesday....they offer free admission twice a month and it wasn't crowded at all! I don't think many people know about the discount.

Everyone we saw was properly masked and social distancing wasn't an issue.

I can't wait to come back to check out The Farm and the planetarium!!

text:
This was such a cool place to learn about so many different things. Local history, habitats, and animals beginning in the Prehistoric Era. Informative and well maintained exhibits.

The planetarium show was really interesting to watch about the Artemis Mission.

Outside there is a wonderful shady trail that it a half mile that circles the property. There are really awesome exhibits outside as well as a play area for the kids, a pond, an old mill, a stone age heritage site and a Catawba Indian Village.

There is also a small farm that you can enjoy with live animals. The cost to enter is $3/pp but we ran out of time today.

This museum could be an all day place to take the kids, pack a lunch and sit at one of the inside tables to eat or at one of the many picnic tables outside.

My children liked it all but,  I wasn't a fan of the dead animals. We especially liked the planetarium. There's also things to do outside! Family of 6 was 36.00

text: This is a hidden gem for any naturalist. There's an emphasis on taxidermied animals and American Indians. There are some exhibits that have been closed for renovation for over a year, so there is less to see. Planetarium prices are NOT included in regular admission or even membership. The outdoor area is free to the public and has nice trails and historic structures along the way. Few things are interactive so there's not a lot for younger kids, with the exception of the pirate ship and a small puppet area.

text:
SUPERB AUTHENTIC THAI in the Pittsburgh area, a short 15 min drive from downtown.  Cozy restaurant with no-touch menu, short and sweet. It looks a popular spot to locals of many persuasions. Takeout or sit in (I have done both), it‚Äôs simply excellent food. A FOODIE‚ÄôS GEM.

Start with Fresh Rolls and Fried Eggplant, contrasting but complementary textures and sweet tangy sauces that wake up the palate (very much unlike the cliche peanut sauce in the run of mill Thai-style places.

Any of the curry entrees are very good, smooth well-balanced sauces; none of that pungent sugar-loaded curry so common in so-called Thai restaurants in this town.

My recommendation: Duck Curry, very crispy well seasoned perfectly cooked duck atop the smooth Red curry with bell peppers and cherry tomatoes, carefully balanced with two halves of lychee just enough to brighten the palate: Simply Wow!

Pair the curry with any of the Thai stir fry veggies.  I‚Äôm partial to the Hot Basil fry, extra veggies (natural sweetness of the fresh vegetables complemented with their brown sauce).

By the way, enjoy Thai food with a spoon rather than fork/knife. Spoon the curry or veggies on rice, mix, then enjoy. Spoon allows one to taste every drop of the sauce.

Great service!

text:
I live directly up the street from this place on Washington Ave and I have got to say that I am absolutely disappointed with their quality of food.  Today, I just recently ordered their Pad Kee Mao and it looked like someone chewed up the meal and spit it right back out into the carry out tray.  The noodles were overly soggy and mushed up like mashed potatoes.  The salad that comes with the Lunch looks as if someone cut out a large chunk from a piece of lettuce, threw it into the tray, and then decided to splash a little sauce on top of it.

I don't normally complain about food and most times I simply ignore the mistakes but I've been living in Bellevue for 3 years now and this incident has happened more than once.  A customer can only be patient so many times and then there comes a point where a enough is enough.  This restaurant will never receive my services ever again.  I don't know if it's the cook or the management but the quality of food is poor.  Years ago the food was much better. I'm not sure what happened between then and now.

If you want a quality restaurant for Thai food, go to Niky's Thai Kitchen.  I promise you, Niky's Thai Kitchen is the better choice.  Their food quality is suburb compared to Thai Tamarind, especially for the price you'll pay for it.

Please observe the images attached for evidence.

text:
Well, it wasn't anywhere NEAR as good as a few years back but the presentation was decent. Of course the prices went up, lol. An almost 3 star. Almost. Sadly I can NOT recommend  Thai Tamarind any longer since the flavors were incredibly weak and/or bland; so much tasted like it came from a jar and the top of the line "thai spicy" was a powder they sprinkled on top of every dish when presenting your level of spicy. Some of the powder hadn't fully dissolved during your meal so you would gets little clumps of it in your mouth. The "so-called" Thai Iced Tea I had tasted as if it were a syrup from a bottle. Yech!

Pictured you have the Tom Yum soup, Volcano Chicken and the Thai Style Chicken Noodle. All bland and weak. Not pictured but as an appetizer we had the chicken satay, another huge let down since when eaten with a homemade peanut sauce or cucumber sauce, it is DELICIOUS! The peanut sauce seems to have some type of dairy added to it. Gross.

Seated WAY in the back corner in the last pic you'll see your "typical American Ken", who did nothing but complain from he moment he sat down. Entitled as "F".
DONT EAT HERE IF YOU DISAPPROVE of the restaurant or its style a**hole!

text:

I'm not particularly fond of hard ceramic hotel room floors as they can be noisy when someone drops something on them (in the middle of the night). For the hospitality alone, I will certainly come back the next time I'm in the area.

text: Bed sheet had a stain. Shower had hair that was not mine.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa
prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

text:
I've stayed at a lot of Marriotts because of business trips in the past 10 years. They usually don't fall below a certain standard, but it seems in this case they did.

The rooms were pricey and we had booked a room with 2 queen beds and they gave us a room with a king and a sofa bed. Now you might think of this as an upgrade if you had a couple booking the room, but this was for 3 people and getting a sofa bed when you have paid for a queen. When i mentioned this in the app, they said they would fix it the next day and they did, and they have us the room right next to ours which made for a very easy transfer through the connecting door, which is what raised my review from 1 star to 2.

I suspect they changed our booking because they were having a convention and needed the room but this isn't an acceptable reason.

Other things that bothered me were the cleanliness of the rooms. I attached a couple of photos showing what our floor was like in the first room and the dirt inside the coffee maker. In both rooms, the coffee makers were terrible with one even having hair in it.

Finally it saddens me to see a sad attempt to look progressive with 3 places to charge an electric car. 2 Tesla spots of which 1 was it of order and 1 for non Tesla electric cars.

If you want to add electric car charging to your hotel add 10 spots not have a token amount and not even functional

I think they rely on the event housing so much they don't really care about their amenities is status of their rooms so much. Because every night we were there they had all least 2 events going on.

For the price and the quality, might as well just stay in mystic close to everything. I don't think I will be going back to this specific Marriott.

text: I had high expectations for this property based on its category and price range. It did not deliver in accordance to its value and how it was advertised. The room I was initially given was not properly cleaned. There were clear signs that the fitted sheet was not laundered. I had to switch rooms, which unfortunately was a downgrade, and there were cleanliness issues in that room as well. The room amenities were lacking, which again is surprising based on category and price. The spa was closed, as well as the hot tub. Those items played a big role in my decision, so I was quite disappointed to find out they were closed. Why didn't the price and category reflect these changes. They are being very misleading, and that's enough to turn me away from Marriott properties. My main concern is they are still advertising as if they have everything together during these times and are charging inflated prices. I am highly upset I did not receive what was expected and now feel like my money put into this property is a major loss. The only thing that was nice is the customer service of the front office staff. The lady taking our breakfast room service order was a little off putting. There was a mistake made with my order. I called to let her know but she seemed upset at me for letting her know their mistake. It was corrected, but her tone was unsettling. The toast was overcooked and stale. Everything else, the omelet, pancakes, chicken sausage, bacon, and potatoes, was made fine. Unfortunately, I will not be returning to this property and do not recommend it.

text: This hotel is AMAZING!! For the price and what you get it is WELL worth it!! My fiance and I stayed here to go to see Brantly Gilbert and Dylan Scott which was very convenient being 15 min away. The rooms were very modern and upscale. Very clean, staff was very friendly and offering assistance throughout our stay. They have a buffet breakfast that was better than any hotel I've ever stayed in. It was real fresh food not that processed stale taste. A chef makes omletes with your fillings right in front of you. They have a upscale restaurant called the OCTAGON it is pricey but well worth it. We had ours delivered via room service!! Their filet mignon is to die for. I highly recommend this hotel and I will be staying with them again

text: I love the Peppermill. They have great food with surprising variety at low prices. I had the inside out grilled cheese. It has baby Swiss, cheddar, tomato, red onion, and avocado on parmesan crusted bread. It was amazing. The onion was flavorful and the creamy avocado made the two melted cheeses even better. The parmesan added another layer of crispness to each bite. I upgraded to tater tots instead of chips, and I was surprised at the large portion. My daughter had a pancake and tots. The pancake was huge, so she only managed half, but she did polish off her tots and some of mine. This was my second time there recently. I can't wait to go back!

text:
Great place, definitely glad to have it near us. Yes it costs more than Hang Time, but it has more to offer. Plus a bunch of couches and several massage chairs for adults.
At Hang Time I'm always worried about where my smaller kids are because you can't keep a good eye everywhere. Feels like it's for older kids and young adults with more trampolines for tricks.

What I like about The Hive it's good for kids of all ages. There's a tetherball with jumping around it. Two interactive video game screens that actually show their picture on screen as they jump, so fun!
Zip line, jumping basketball, targets, go carts (costs extra), the biggest bounce house/obstacle course I've ever seen. Regular trampolines too, rock wall, ninja warrior obstacles, slack line.

There are drinking fountains, but they're by the go carts (kind of annoying they're so far).
They also have bands to wear that have lights that change color when your time is up. They do have lockers as well.
Overall, we'll go again, but less frequently because of the cost. Still, i thought it was worth it, especially for families with kids.

text:
Very nice little place in the middle of nothing. I mean there is literally nothing around for miles. That being said this is a nice little place that is reasonably priced. We got the deluxe room. They are old fashioned style but well maintained and is basicall like a suite. In a big city you would pay top dollar for a room like this but our rate was close to $100... not bad at all. Definitely recommend if you are traveling and going to pass through here this would be a great place to stop and get some rest...

They hotel grill closes at 10pm which no one told us but if you are really hungry you can head over to the truck travel center, that grill is open 24 hours...

text: Little America is a good option if you need a break from freeway driving. The bathrooms are clean and the convenience store has about anything you need while traveling. The grill has decent options if you want a hot meal. Gas prices here are always inflated so I generally choose to fill up elsewhere. The hotel rooms seem clean, but the decor is very interesting; it reminds me of furniture and decorations my grandma would have had in her house back in the 70s or 80s. The service has always been pretty good. If you ever get caught in one of Wyoming's infamous 1-80 winter storms, Little America can be a refuge.

text: Nicest roach motel I've stayed at.  It looks cute and quaint from a distance, but don't be fooled into booking a room there.  AC was not adequate.  Had to leave the sliding patio door open for air, which was really hard to move because it was off its rollers.  It was also not secure because the patio is shared with every room on that side of the building.  The room was not clean.  There was trash left from the previous occupant: receipt in the dresser, pizza crust under the bed, comb on the bathroom sink, and water in the ice bucket.  There was a brown crusty substance on the edge of the bathroom garbage can.  The bed sheets were too short and because I'm tall my feet were rubbing on the rough protective pad underneath.  Both beds were like that but I was the only one tall enough to notice.  The map of the grounds they gave us was a bad copy and it was hard to read the amenities.  I thought there might be a nicer version in the amenities book in the room but the book had nothing in it at all.  This means we knew nothing about the hotel other than what was on the bad map.  We didn't have any phone numbers to call for service or if it was possible to order food from the restaurant.  We went in the pool, which had several places where it had cracked and was missing chunks of concrete and tiles.  The deep end separation floaters were all destroyed and were held up by the rope.  We avoided several bad sections of the pool due to it's horrible condition.  When we checked out in the morning it was so early (6:15 AM) that we had to check out at the gift shop and the staff there were not pleasant.  This was also where you payed for gas, and it had the restaurant in it.  The restaurant menu was horrible.  I couldn't order anything due to the limited menu.  The payment system was down and they didn't seem to have a manual backup system so we had to wait, delaying our departure.

text:
We LOVE western Wyoming's Little America! This was the first Little America we ever visited (over two years ago) and it is our favorite by far! (Little America Flagstaff is a close second.) We've never stayed at the hotel, but the travel center is excellent!

The shower rooms are always spotless and so cozy, each having its own huge, glass-doored, tile shower, and a separate soaking tub as an added bonus that we always look forward to. Showers are $12, and they provide mineral bath gel, bars of soap, and plenty of clean, warm towels. We stop solely for the amazing showers, but stick around a little longer for the food.

The grill has exceeded our expectations as far as a travel center food stop goes - the menu is kinda limited, but they have several different choices, from burgers to breakfast to fried chicken. The food is made to order and everything we've had has been so delicious. (My personal favorite is the breakfast burrito with sausage gravy.) The grill is also open 24 hours a day and serving everything on the menu all day long. Sure beats a basic fast food stop at any of the other travel centers!

In our experience, the staff at this location have been very friendly, welcoming, and happy to meet whatever need that arises, round the clock. If you're a trucker, get here early (or super late night) if you hope to find a parking spot. This is the last travel stop for a while if you're eastbound, and the veteran drivers already know how awesome this place is, so the lot fills up quick and there's usually a ton of create-a-spot tetris going on come nightfall.

The Little America experience is never short of amazing for us, and so memorable that every time we leave we can hardly wait until our next visit! Plus, they have a great view from the parking lot. Rolling hills, plateaus, and snow-capped mountains are hard to beat!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming
prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.
completion:

The grill has exceeded our expectations as far as a travel center food stop goes - the menu is kinda limited, but they have several different choices, from burgers to breakfast to fried chicken. The food is made to order and everything we've had has been so delicious. (My personal favorite is the breakfast burrito with sausage gravy.) The grill is also open 24 hours a day and serving everything on the menu all day long. Sure beats a basic fast food stop at any of the other travel centers!

In our experience, the staff at this location have been very friendly, welcoming, and happy to meet whatever need that arises, round the clock. If you're a trucker, get here early (or super late night) if you hope to find a parking spot. This is the last travel stop for a while if you're eastbound, and the veteran drivers already know how awesome this place is, so the lot fills up quick and there's usually a ton of create-a-spot tetris going on come nightfall.

The Little America experience is never short of amazing for us, and so memorable that every time we leave we can hardly wait until our next visit! Plus, they have a great view from the parking lot. Rolling hills, plateaus, and snow-capped mountains are hard to beat!

An oasis in the desert, almost literally. Good customer service and great ice cream cones ( especially the prices at $75 a piece).

text: Hotel is extremely outdated and staff needs to brush up on their customer service skills. The property probably hasn't had any sort of renovation since the 90's and it is long overdue. I was offered a package when I checked in which included a discount if I spent $30 in the gift shop/restaurant/gas station. I was told to bring back my receipts and they would apply the discount. The next morning I went into the front desk with my receipts only to be told I needed to turn them in the night before. I told the front desk attendant that I was not informed that it had to be turned in the same day I checked in, only to bring my receipts back and the front desk lady would take off the discount.  The front desk attendant rudely said,  "yeah her and she's not here". I then asked for a manager who quickly resolved the problem. If you're going to have a strict policy on how long customers have to turn in receipts for credits on a package I didn't even ask for then you need to inform the customers of that policy. Additionally, having a bad attitude with a customer who was obviously not informed correctly by your staff will not earn you business. I will NEVER stay here again!  Gross, outdated and rude staff!

text: My girls loved it and deemed our large double queen room with pink tiled bathroom - a princess room. The beds were comfortable and we had one of our best nights sleep there during our travels. The bathroom fixtures are a bit strange but it just takes a bit of testing to get it right. Overall the hotel was very quiet for us despite the property doubling as a 24 hour truck stop. We were in a very quiet unit (no pets). I've heard others say the other units can be noisier (pets allowed) as they are closer to the trucking amenities. Lastly, there is a playground and fun statues for the kids to get on - the Sinclair dinosaur and a giant buffalo. There is a once live penguin in the check in area. Really cool place with gorgeous Wyoming scenery. Planning a big family trip there again with more relatives! What a find.

text:
Myself and 5 friends went tonight to celebrate our good friend's engagement and wedding coming up next month with something a little different! We had an amazing time, the food was totally different than what we normally would find but so good, we had a ton of fun picking out our meals, trying all the different things, and just enjoying the experience. The wait staff was phenomenal, I honestly think Allison was a highlight of our evening. She was very personable, made us feel entirely comfortable, and had great tips and information on the menu.

We were gifted with extras at dessert, champagne for those of us that partook in cocktails and N/A sparkling juice for those that didn't and it was SO good! Super refreshing! We also (seriously, they were so amazing) were gifted a bite of something delicious - I apologize for not remembering what it was by the pastry chef this evening - but it had almonds, was a dessert bar of some sort and it was really good - not super sweet, honestly would have gone great with coffee if any of us had room for it - which we most certainly did not.

The atmosphere was wonderful, even being in proximity to other tables it still felt intimate enough that we couldn't hear other parties' conversations, nor could they hear ours, and I feel like we were a little rambunctious at times. Also, my friends that had cocktails said nothing but high praise for them - my coke with lime was also top notch * in case anyone cared ;)

Food. That's why you're reading this, yeah?
It was good. Like, really great. It also felt like a performance at times. Lots of fun pouring, super attentive taking items away, never once had to ask for anything, be it water, napkin, silverware, etc etc. Maybe we're cheap dates but I'm fairly certain everyone went above and beyond, exceeding our expectations. Thanks for a great experience!

In case my photo captions don't save:
1. Scallops
2. Surprise Carrot & Cardamom Soup option (big fan of this, you don't know unless you KNOW)
3. Beef Medallion Filet - my favorite of the 3 savory dishes
4. The best dang dessert option there is - even though the mousse looked and sounded amazing - I will DIE on this chocolatey-citrus hill any day. Any. Day. This chocolate cake (better than the chocolate cake in your head, bet) and orange sorbet - beyond. Be.yond.

We will be back for the soup for sure.

text:
Our wedding at Lake Park Bistro was absolutely perfect. We had a tented reception with cocktail hour on the gorgeous East Balcony with stunning views of Lake Michigan. The restaurant's white pillars were a perfect location for photos and the surrounding park offered more beautiful options all with in a walking distance. The staff was fantastic and our guests were thrilled with their prompt and friendly service. We also received many, many compliments on the food from our family and friends; even those ‚Äòhard to impress‚Äô said their meal at Lake Park Bistro was the best they‚Äôd ever had at a wedding. However, the best thing about Lake Park Bistro was working with Dan. He made us feel comfortable and welcome every step of the way and provided us with excellent advice to make our day fun and stress-free. Dan was clear in all of our communications and went above and beyond to host a meeting for myself and my other vendors. His honest feedback and recommendations helped make our day personal, special, and truly, the best day of our lives. We truly can not say enough about our wonderful experience at Lake Park Bistro, thank you Dan and team!!

(Photos from Dawn Silva Photography)

text:
It's been a few years since we have stayed here and unfortunately will probably be the last time. I received an email inviting me to stay there which stated they had newly remodeled rooms, which made us want to go ahead and book here instead of our usual other option. Well, our visit was less than satisfying. We drove up Sunday afternoon to check in and were told there was no valet service - park across the street, and walk back to check in (was not allowed to keep my car in their driveway while checking in). Not a good start. Check in line had about 10 parties waiting to check in and only two front desk folks (after about 10 minutes one more front desk agent showed up). Once in the room, I was confused how they could state the rooms were remodeled(?). Bathroom was great (only one hook to hang towels), the room was painted, but the furniture was still old and scratched up, the chair was creaking with every move and the thermostat was very dirty (not huge, but very noticeable). The casino had no live tables, so we had to go somewhere else to play - I prefer to just stay in my hotel to gamble. As far as the 'Resort Fee', it lists 2 water bottles (helpful on a 100 degree day), but never got that - I called down to see if they could be brought over and never got them. There were a couple of coffee pods with a sign stating they will be refreshed every morning, they are not. I called the 2nd morning to get a couple, but ended up running to Starbucks instead (Why are they charging a resort fee???). If this covers the parking, maybe think about charging the people parking in your lot and not staying at your hotel.
In any case, with all the alternative hotels in Reno I will not be booking another room at Circus Circus. I'll keep the old memories of what they used to be years ago.
One plus, we enjoyed the view from our room.

text:
Our experience here was awesome! My boyfriend and I did 'The Lost Ship' room. It was a Wednesday 7pm booking, so just the two of us took on the challenge without anyone else booking in. And we escaped with 90 seconds to spare!! Our guide, Captain Charles, did a fantastic job introducing the room to us with this whole back story to set us up. If you pay close attention, there are clues in everything he's saying as well.

The room itself was the best part. It was actually several rooms all joined together and from the lobby you had to figure out how to even enter the main room in the first place‚Äîsuper cool! I had never seen anything like that before. The puzzles were also really well thought out and interesting, using logic and problem solving (not at all abstract or random). Of all the escape rooms I have done, I would say that this has been the best experience I have had because of the attention to detail in the room, the quality of the puzzles, and the experience of being able to solve it with just the two of us.

The room is actually designed for at least 6 people, because it would have been helpful for others to take on and simultaneously solve riddles in the room. I'm pretty amazed we were able to do it with just 2 (but it was mostly because we had a few timely hints... big ones, lol). Awesome experience, highly recommend!!!

P.S. - This location has only this room (Pirate's Booty 2 - The Lost Ship), and the other rooms are in their downtown location. So don't be confused ^_^

text: Such an awesome place. I've been hearing from friends that not many people know about this zoo. If you have young kids, bring them here and have a great time. All the animals are rescue animals and are fun to look at. The zoo staff are friendly. There is also toy train ride we can enjoy.

prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: Such an awesome place. I've been hearing from friends that not many people know about this zoo. If you have young kids, bring them here and have a great time. All the animals are rescue animals and are fun to look at. The zoo staff are friendly. There is also toy train ride we can enjoy.

text: What an amazing little zoo. I highly recommend going when they open because the animals are more active. We got to see the lions, tigers and bears up super close. To see those majestic animals that close was epic.
title: Austin Zoo
prompt: A Google Maps review about a zoo.
completion: What an amazing little zoo. I highly recommend going when they open because the animals are more active. We got to see the lions, tigers and bears up super close. To see those majestic animals that close was epic.

text: Check your expectations. This is a rescue zoo, not a full-fledged corporate-sponsored zoo like the big ones. They have a great variety for being a small sanctuary. The paths are dirt and gravel, so wear close-toed shoes. If you or someone you are with is in a wheelchair, it may be a little rough, but we saw a few people in standard and motorized chairs. There are about 50 peacocks free roaming and in habitats. Also, it is the spring, so expect some frisky animals. The big cats can spray you if you get too close or they think you are a threat. There is a train that is about $5/rider. It is a nice little ride around the back of some of the paddocks. Every single staff member was super friendly and helpful and knowledgable. Though they don‚Äôt have concessions, they do have vending machines throughout the park. There are a few regular bathrooms that are wheelchair accessible. There are also quite a few portable toilets to the right of the entrance. The wolves, cougars, lions, and tiger were all big draws. The bears were not out when we went. This zoo is out in ranch country (started as a goat farm). Keep in mind the roads are curvy and tight.

text: Had some free time on a Sunday morning and thought we'd check out the zoo in our new city. Now we're from San Diego (home to the World Famous San Diego Zoo) so we know great zoos. As my teenager daughter said, it's like a petting zoo. This is not your typical zoo. They rescue animals (there was a three-legged fox there). The walkways are dirt. The variety of animals is limited. I'd say this is a great place for families with young kids. It's a couple hour adventure for young ones. We walked through in under an hour.

text: Definitely worth the drive! While not as big and sprawling as the San Diego or Denver Zoo, the Austin Zoo has a cool selection of animals that the kids loved and we're able to actually see the animals a lot closer then they would of been anywhere else. I've never been able to see multiple peacocks up close and personal before! The park was very clean with lots of trees for shade. The staff really made this place shine as EVERYONE said hello or good morning, honestly it was surreal how friendly everyone was!

text: I had a lot of fun here. There were lots of unique animals. A lot of them were tired from the summer heat but so were we. It's a fun place to walk around. We turned our backs to the white tiger and she jumped at us. It was startling but pretty cool at the same time. It may not be as paved and built up as zoos like the San Antonio and Houston Zoo but it's has it's own charm that I really enjoyed. It was amazing to be able to see a rescue zoo! We got to see many of the animals eating and relaxing, it was a really great experience. I would recommend to anyone who lives in the area.

I loved being able to visit the Galapagos tortoises!

text: I hardly ever leave bad reviews but compared to San Antonio zoo this place was such a let down. Most of the animals are all caged up so you can‚Äôt really see them. We went on pretty chilly day and all the tropical birds were sharing one little heat lamp and you could tell they were so distressed. The animals looked pretty miserable to be honest. The only parts we enjoyed were the feeding of the farm animals which you can‚Äôt even do like at a petting zoo you have to feed them through the fence. The train and the conductor were the best part. He was super nice and pretty funny. He offered to take our pics which I appreciated. But if your not from Austin and thinking about making the trip out here‚Ä¶don‚Äôt. Seriously the snake farm in new branfuels was in better shape and condition than this. Drive out to San Antonio and go to a real zoo or if your looking for something more hands on drive to Johnson city to go to the exotic resort zoo, there are a lot more animals there and they look much more attended too. We left this place pretty sad.

text:
This little zoo is great! We went here on a weekday, so it wasn't very crowded. The zoo is a rescue zoo, so all the animals are surrendered or given to them by other zoos or state facilities.
Every enclosure has a sign with some information about the animal species and also the backstory of this animal specific which I love. I think this provides a lot of education to people.
I love the lions, they were so beautiful, I wish they had a more engaging enclosure same with the bears ( which they are renovating).
There's also a train to see some additional animals which can't be seen by foot.
This zoo is great for all ages, to see the animals and learn about their species and backstories.

text: The food here was absolutely terrific! Some places offer homestyle dishes like your mom used to make. This place offers homestyle dishes like someone else's mom made, and they're all delicious. My favorite was the shepherds pie, but everything they served was great. Wednesday nights are "buffeteria" style. They serve you like a cafeteria but you keep going back until you're finished. Non-members price was $16.95 which I felt was fair for the quality of food and service provided. If you want to try something a little out of the ordinary I highly recommend a Edelweiss! I'll certainly be back when I cost the area again. Call ahead reservations are recommended.

text:
This place is amazing.  Talk about taking yourself back in time for a minute you feel like you are in Germany.  They open at 5pm for dinner only.  You drive down this  dark road, and you would never know there was a parking lot and a restaurant from the top of the road.
You go inside from the parking lot on a top level,  down a flight of  stairs is the restaurant.  They do have an elevator for handicap.
Once below it's amazing.  It's small probably about 30 tables, wooden walls, and all decorated with Germany memorabilia.
I was so excited to try this place the last time I had German food was in Germany 20 plus years ago.  I still remember what that tasted like.
There was 2 waitress serving and taking orders. Lisa was our waitress.  She is such a nice lady,  and definitely knows her menu,  and has worked their for a long time.  I ordered the German beer on tap it was very light, clear, and refreshing. My other half Bayrischer Schweinebraten it was a tender slow roasted pork shoulder.  I tasted the dish and it was amazing.  Very tender and with lots of flavor.  It was not sliced it was more like chunk pork. His side was the sliced apples.  I have never tried apples sliced fresh, in a cinnamon sauce.  I wish you could order this by the pint or quart to take home.  Amazing!
I ordered J√§gerschnitzel which was delicious with the cream white wine sauce, and mushroom.  The sauce was so good I asked for a little more sauce. The pork meat was tender, and a nice slice. My sides was potato pancakes oh my goodness hold the fork these were not greasy at all.  I put the sour cream and applesauce on the potato cakes. My other side I was wanting to try was the German potato salad.  It was good, completely traditional,  but not my favorite for my taste buds. Before dinner you have a choice of soup or salad.  I definitely tried the soup which was really good the traditional red cabbage soup.
I can't wait to come back to try more dishes.
For dessert if you have room definitely order the bread pudding with the warm whiskey sauce.  You will want to make room for this dessert.
We were getting ready to leave, they were closing, and they were so nice they make everything fresh daily, and had extra apple and cherry turnovers. I had taken home 1 of each. The next day with a cup of coffee, warmed up,  very good.
I can't wait to come back!
Thank you ladies for such a great experience.

text:
This is truly a hidden gem!

They have a dance group anyone can join; it's been very fun! Wednesdays at 7PM, except for the 2nd Wednesday each month.  I have literally no dance background, but this is folk dancing, so that's fine üòÅ

Edelweiss is located in German Park at the end of the drive.  The park itself isn't anything major, but the scenery is very nice.
Once at the parking lot, you can go in the main entrance and down the stairs to the restaurant or follow the sidewalk north of the building where it slopes down and around the building to their outdoor seating. You can see a gnome garden along the way!
I've seen comments saying this place isn't handicap accessible, but this sidewalk is the entrance to take if you have a wheelchair or stroller.  Understandably, this will be inconvenient if it is raining.
The outdoor seating is the beer garden area and the doors lead into the restaurant.

On Wednesdays there is a buffet.  I'm writing this review after a stop at their buffet and I'm impressed.
On Fridays they have live music; simply amazing fun!

They have several events through the year and I definitely recommend checking them out! Fr√ºhlingsfest, J√§gerfest, Octoberfest and more!

Through the year, they have several German events, including an Octoberfest.  From what I hear, it's a blast!

Additionally, a local Duolingo group has started holding language events here and, separately, there is a lady who gives basic German lessons in the fall.
*Note* September 2022 - I'm not certain if these have started up again yet.

text:
The Elm is beautiful, gorgeous even, and the staff were friendly, attentive and good at their jobs. The menu is big enough that there are enough choices but it's not overwhelming. The cocktail menu is inventive.
I mention all of this because the bar, from the moment you walk in the door, is set very very high. And the food is great. It's just not quite as beautiful as the decor or as perfect as the menu describes.
The tostones are plentiful and the brussel sprouts are crispy. But the sauces leave something to be desired.
The steak and lamb were excellently cooked but greens and asparagus needed a little more flavor.
But hot damn the olive oil cake was good. The seasonal rhubarb, strawberry and pistachio pairing was divine. Textures and flavors, yum!
I'll be back for espresso and dessert ASAP!

text:
Fantastic interior layout, private dining area from the bar. My brother and I came here for dinner he was in town and I haven't been here yet so we decided to try it. Food was interesting to say the least, we got the CALABRIAN CHILI CUCUMBERS for an app and it was more tangy like pickled cucumbers. Still very refreshing. I got the SWEET CORN AGNOLOTTI  , charred corn very sweet with shredded crab mix, pretty good however needed a little salt added.
My brother got BRAISED PORK BELLY, cooked an amazin crispy skin , however, this one was overly salted. Not bad but our palette was interesting.
Then we ended with dessert CHOCOLATE MOUSSE CAKE and Seasonal Truffles (3)
By far my favorite I've tried, subtle , flavor isn't overpowering (I don't have that much of a sweet tooth) would definitely get the dessert again! The truffles was alright, dark chocolate and white chocolate. Tasted really nice.
Great experience, menu is seasonal so it's nice to see different options.

text: It's hard to believe a place like this exists in Bloomington. It's like walking into a trendy bar / restaurant in a major city. The cocktails are original and interesting. I ordered the Choconut Negroni and it was unlike anything and I have drunk before. And interesting blend of Jen, cocoa nib infused sweet remove, and coconut fat washed campari, It is entirely original and fun to drink. Next I tried the espresso martini. I've had plenty of those in my lifetime and this one was a new twist. Two different kinds of Espresso and tiramisu liqueur woke me up and provided just the right amount of decadence. I didn't try the menu but it looks excellent. This would be a great place to come with friends or on a date night.

text: I want to begin by saying I really love the atmosphere. The tables are spaced out enough that there is not much noise and it‚Äôs easy to talk to your table. The interior decoration is also very beautiful. There is not much parking but I live close so I walked. The food was delicious but there were just enough weird things that made me give 4 instead of 5 stars. The bread and butter (which is its own appetizer) is OK but definitely not anything to write home about, the butter pat was cold so not easily spreadable. I ordered the cauliflower main dish with sauce and golden raisins knowing it would be lighter than a meat main. However, with the price of the dish, I was expecting a bit more than 1/4 of a cauliflower head for my main meal. I know inflation and prices are high but cauliflower? Seems they could‚Äôve spared a bit more. Additionally the olive oil cake with rhubarb and strawberry ice cream was good but the ice cream stole the show! The cake itself was just ok and the rhubarb had not been sweetened enough to make it palatable, I ended up taking it off. The service was good but not great, we had a new server and she made a few missteps that ultimately would have cost our party money if we hadn‚Äôt spoken up (as opposed to slow service, etc). Overall, I definitely want to go back to the elm, i will just choose my dishes more carefully.

text:
My wife and I originally booked a reservation for 8pm on a Friday night but decided to come an hour early to see if we could sit at the bar for a couple of drinks first.

We ended up staying at the lower bar and eating a wonderful dinner. Mostly because of our bartender‚Äôs kindness, professionalism and the great ambiance.

Mushroom kushiyaki and charred avocado for a starter. Then, egg yolk raviolo and chicken roulade for our main course. Delicious on all counts.

It‚Äôs set up as a cafe, as well. We didn‚Äôt experience this side of it. But, highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a nice dinner in Bloomington.

text: Elm was lovely! All the staff was so warm, friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was so unique for Bloomington. I felt transported to a metropolitan area‚Ä¶in all the best ways! It‚Äôs upscale, but yet cozy and modern. The mezzanine had a different vibe than the downstairs, but both were lovely! They also have a separate room upstairs for a small event or work meeting/lunch. The homemade gnocchi with pesto sauce and toasted pine nuts was also delicious! I can‚Äôt wait for my next visit!

text:
Update 2/14/23

Walking up to the main entrance of the casino was worse than before.  Cigarettes are all over,  things need painted and everything could do well with a good powerwashing.  Nothing about this 1st glance gives me "destination resort" vibes.    We arrived around 8:30 in the morning so it was obvious this littered mess was not fresh.  If this place wants to pull in new customers and become a major moneymaker,  things need to change.  When your facility is much less clean than the local gas stations,  you have an issue.   Granted,  the inside is clean,  but the outside is what sets the tone.  Do better, Mardi Gras!

Original review:  We have stayed here numerous times through the years.  This last visit was already a letdown due to no pool and none of the amazing breakfast foods.  The room was not the cleanest and the gold fixtures are now chrome and gold due to someone using the incorrect cleaner.  All of the restaurants in the casino were closed and there was no room service.

My suggestions to help would be:

Breakfast:  Since the old buffet style won't work,  the easiest way to serve the delicious hot breakfast would be for each room to put an order in either online or by calling concierge.  Their items would be prepared and could be dropped off contactless outside of the room or could be picked up in the lobby.

Cleaning:  Supervisor checking rooms to make sure they are bring cleaned properly.  They should also be sure to teach proper use of cleaning agents and which products to use on each surface.

Restaurants:  If none of the on site eateries are going to be open,  either offer meals via room service again or at least put together a listing of nearby restaurants and contact information.   Maybe even see if any would be willing to give hotel guests a discount.

I know some of these items seem small but if you want to call yourself a resort and be a destination vacation spot,  you can't overlook the little things.

text:
Challenging holes are carved out of the hillside along the river at this course to provide something for everyone. First and foremost there is more vertical change at this course than many I have played in the past. Some pin locations are a hundred feet above the tee box while others are the same downhill. This makes it almost a must to rent a cart if you are playing 18, unless you are in peak physical condition.

The clubhouse is big and clean with friendly staff members to help out with your needs. The range is quite short and narrow, only 200 yards max by about 20 yards wide which makes it hard to warm up for the long shots you will need to be successfull right off the first tee. The carts are older and gas powered which made it tricky to get up some if the steep hills and there is some slow play if you are behind the wrong group.

Insider tip: make sure to study the course before you go if you haven't played here. There are hidden creeks and obstacles that ruin great shots down the middle. Better yet, play a practice round so you'll be ready before taking it on!

text:
Four of us from Honolulu, Hawaii played this course on September 26, 2016 and we absolutely enjoyed the round.  Great staff, course and surroundings. Had previously called Bob to inquire about the course due to the mixed reviews.  Wildwood GC provides exceptional value and we put this course on our play again course whenever we're up here in the Portland area. Our foursome consisted of three Waialae Country Club and one Mid-Pacific Country Club members.  Mahalo Bob for taking great care of us.

Returned to play with some other buddies on May 6, 2017 before heading back to Honolulu the next day after a  five day golfing tour in the greater Portland area.  They were impressed Wildwood is on their "will play again" list.  Thanks Tom and the rest of the staff for taking care of us and welcoming us back.  Will be back up there in early-October with the original 2016 Honolulu guys!

PS: Wildwood has great drainage so this is one of three courses we now know that is playable after heavy rains.

text:
Just played here on Sunday 10/6, about three weeks post-punching. The greens are fantastic. They're rolling very smooth and true..and at a great speed. They're firm, yet they're holding shots the way they should. Also, the traps were all hand raked, and fairways were very playable.

Look for a new expanded green complex and new lower tee on the par three # 6, and new tee locations on # 7. One thing that always impresses me about Wildwood, is the attention to detail, and the constant reinvestment in the course and clubhouse.

Also, the service is always friendly and accommodating. If you've never played Wildwood, be sure to give it a try. It's a real hidden gem of a golf course, with plenty of interesting holes, lots of character and challenges, and spectacular views.

And finally, Wildwood is in such a peaceful, serene setting, that it has an amazing overall calming impact on my game, as you can see in the photo below, taken at the 15th tee.

I play courses that charge more or just as much as Wildwood, but are over crowded and not as pretty. The layout provides variety for the holes. It has a parkland feel that is cut into a hill side. There is only one house that lines the fairway. About half of the holes have an elevated gain at the green or tee box.  It might be a ride for some. If the walk from the first tee box or the walk to the 9th green look steep to you. You have a similar walk about 9 or 10 times. Even though it is right off HWY 30, it is really peaceful on the course.

text:
Wildwood has it all in the name! It's wild and in the woods. Expect to use a cart or be sore the next day from walking- but those are both great options!

Nestled in the foothills of Forest Park (one of the nation's largest urban pakrs) the gorgeous setting allows unparalleled views. If you find yourself frustrated about your golf game, you can take a moment to see beautiful glimpses Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens, and countless other bounties of nature.

Oh yes of course- golf! The course itself is well-maintained, and has its own unique blend of challenges and opportunities. Navigating through a "normal" course is challenged in its own rite, but couple that with nestling into the side of a mountain and you have Wildwood!

You owe it to yourself to make the trip out there to enjoy it. You can thank me later!

text:
Reserved our deluxe king room with jetted tub for Sept 19th back in mid June 2021 & requested a quiet location (if possible). They put us in room 314, which was located on 3rd of 4 floors, right outside of the elevators & across from the ice machine room (very noisy).

The bath towels were thin, rough, and worn (one had two rips on edges... see pics). Jetted tub was the best part of the room, but took forever to fill up. But, for some stupid reason there was NO vent fan in the bathroom! Horrible!

The furnishings were a bit dated & I wouldn't call the size of the king room a "deluxe". Reserved that room purely because I knew after a 12 hr drive I'd want to soak in a nice big bath tub. Mattress was comfy, but only 3 squishy pillows (not 4) on the king sized bed (no neck support at all).

I wouldn't pay $172 (after taxes) for another stay in a king sized room there (booked thru Expedia.com). A bit disappointing.

text: I am appalled at the quality of service and food at this place. While a family of Mexicans sitting next to us got served like royalty we were put on the back burner the waitress came over a total of three times while we were there. She also loved to flirt with her boss the whole time while ignoring us! We ran out of chips and salsa asked for more and didn't get any until after we got our food. When I got my plate. The portion was so small ! I had maybe 10 tiny pieces of meat and 4 pieces of shrimp on my dish which was the muscle maker . The lettuce was all brown and nasty. The avocado looked rotten. The dish looked nothing like the picture on the menu. I would have sent it back immediately but the waitress ran off and never even came back until it was to bring  the check. Waste of money and time.

I've been waiting for a place like this for a long time since moving to Noblesville in 2006. This place is excellent, friendly staff and the place looked spotless. My torta was very tasty and look forward to trying the taco's next time I come.
Well done guys

text: Used to love staying at Tropicana. The new food options are good but everything else is sub par. Stayed this time in the Chelsea tower and despite how nice the walkway is to get there, the rooms are gross. Smelled like mildew and the blankets, light shades and table were all stained. The curtains looked like they had blood stains all over them.  The windows were wet and the wallpaper peeling off. The carpet was not clean in the room or hallways. It‚Äôs dark n dingy in the hallways. Plus you can always add an additional hour and half to check-in and get out of the parking garage.

text:
Made our annual trip to AC and had a good time at the Tropicana. Plenty to do inside the casino, centrally located to everything we wanted to do outside the casino. Attached parking garage.

Decent selection of restaurants, bars, lounges stores and eateries in the casino and mall. No complaints, good customer service.

Stayed in the West Tower, rooms were nice enough, but the elevators and bathroom could use an update. Honestly, how much time do you spend in a hotel room on vacation?

text:
Our trip was booked several weeks prior to our arrival. The self check in booths were declining many booked hotel guests, stating our rooms weren‚Äôt ready and they‚Äôd emhoyelus when it was. It was alr 6pm, and the kiosks weren‚Äôt accurate! The lines after the mass confusion and frustration began and lasted beyond an hour and some for others, with less than minimal staff at the desk to accommodate the error. This is unacceptable.
Mind you, we are here with my step daughter for a cheer competition, so there are many parents and elementary aged and younger children filling this lobby waiting for resolution.
After we‚Äôre able to get checked in, we come up to our room in the west wing‚Ä¶ seriously the most ghetto room I‚Äôve ever stayed in. I would never have anticipated a casino hotel room to be in such dated/dirty/and sloppy conditions. Bathroom is filthy, tub/shower walls stained and smells like cigarette. Cigarette burn hole in bed linen, and the paint job looks like it was done by my grandchildren. The coffee maker is broken and filthy with thick calcium buildup. There isn‚Äôt a dresser to put our clothes away. Mold in the shower molding.
The pictures on your website do NOT portray an image of the trash hole we walked into last night! We‚Äôre beyond disappointed, and have never had an experience as poor as this at any casino we‚Äôve gone to before. I plan on calling the front desk this morning for some kind of resolution.
Addendum‚Ä¶ step daughter just showed us a used band aid in her bed üò£
Spoke with management yesterday, they returned our phone call after 9 hours, offered us a different room today, however, it‚Äôs after 2pm and the room just now is ready. The replacement coffee maker and clean linen by the folded lump sum came up after several phone calls after 10:30 pm last night.
Manager stated this casino sleeps whatever sum of people and it‚Äôs difficult to keep up and please everyone. Change of room without a guaranteed time and a $50 food and beverage voucher for one of their places within the casino doesn‚Äôt make this stay worth the money I‚Äôve spent at this casino!
I plan on calling management again tonight or tomorrow, I will update. Hopefully it‚Äôs better than the less than interested game they‚Äôve shown so far.

text: So after a bad experience at another Atlantic City Casino we decided to go to the one that doesn't disappoint...well this time it was just ok.  All Restaurants open and food great, Palm, Broadway Burger and Casa Taco and Tequilla Bar, A++ Room was ok for a Junior Suite.  Regular Staff friendly.  One of the pitboss in the BlackJack area was rude and nasty, my wife never played so we wanted to play...literally got our chips, didn't play a hand and cashed in..story to long to tell.  Table games really horrible, with online gaming and Casinos just 10mins from people's houses, AC better losing the strings cause traveling to AC to lose money in 20mins ain't worth the trip anymore!

text: We had such a fantastic time. The staff was so helpful, and security was spot on. Even stop me from eating at the slots, but I respect their wishes and covid protocols. Also, we appreciate security for their fast response to a 4 AM noise complaint. My mom and I stayed in the north tower and loved every minute of it. The shower was hot ü•µ in all the right ways. No dust was found, and the mirror and air ducts were spotless. The beds were extremely comfortable and spacious. You may need to call for a blanket if you enjoy your room below 65. The north tower was closest to the marketplace. My mom and I loved it, as it took us 1 minute to get to the breakfast and food section. The quarter isn‚Äôt too far, but we loved our stay and flight. We have already booked another trip. I wish we did have the north tower again, but I didn‚Äôt mind exploring the other tower's benefits. Please visit, and wear your walking shoes or chunky heels. This hotel is lovely, full of great people, and has too much fun for a short stay. In addition to that, visit the Hash House of Go-Go and get Yvette. She‚Äôs a genuinely unique waitress. I promise you won‚Äôt regret the meals or air drinks.

text:
We had an overall great experience! Food selections were fantastic. I'd give it a 4 star but we stayed in the West Tower and it is desperate need of a renovation. Wallpaper peeling, we found a cockroach on the wall and the bedding is very poor quality. Room was freezing with no way to change the temperature.
At the casino, drink service at the table games is SOOOO slow and a soda if you go get your own is $5. There should be drink rounds at least every hour, not 3 hours.
Valet service is super slow so give yourself time.
It's vacation though so all of these kind of things happen but some small changescould make this place better!!
Come on Ceasars, you can do it!!

text:
Be aware that unless you book directly through the Tropicana hotel (website), you're more likely working with a booking agency (not directly affiliated with the Tropicana Hotel) and you won't  know the total cost of the room until you check in at the hotel.

Your room is subject to taxes and fees (TOURISM FEE/TAX 2; CASINO FEE/TAX 2; A.C. OCC SURCHARGE/TAX 2; RESORT FEE/TAX 2) that booking agents don't disclose when you make and pay for your reservation (a least ours didn't).

These additional fees and taxes increased the cost of the 2-night stay from $92.70 to $184.01.

While the final cost may not be outrageous, it is certainly (at twice the listed nightly rate) more than you expected when you booked the room.

In addition to that, our booking agent charged only $50 (of the total cost of our stay) to my credit card at the time of booking, leaving the remaining balance to be paid at check-in. And the reservation was not confirmed for the section of the hotel whee we prefer to stay.

Our room was cold both nights but after a 'jump start', it started to warm up a bit (recycling regularly on it's own for the 1st time since we arrived). Annoying, yes. But not worth relocating or having to wait for someone from maintenance to show up and address the problem. The room was clean, good sized, uncarpeted, poorly lit (and heated) with just a desk, one lonely desk chair, a safe and mini fridge (that whined) and no microwave.

Spacious bathroom with pull bars in the tub/shower but only one hook to hang things on (towels, PJ's, wash cloths or anything else).

Parking is NOT FREE, but it's reasonable.

As long as you know what to expect when you book, you can relax and enjoy the place. It would be nice, I think, if Jersey lawmakers would require these booking agencies to disclose their status and all of the additional costs when they take your call.

text: We had a great time at Tropicana!  The casino was very clean.  I booked the Havana room in the Havana Tower.  Views from the room were incredible! Great price just after Christmas.   Check in was easy and fast.  Just make sure you have your driver's license ready for the check in kiosk.  We had drinks at the Saloon and the tequila bar downstairs.  The nachos at the tequila bar were incredible!  Get it with the chicken.  You won't be disappointed!  We went here for my birthday and ate at Carmines.  Ordered the meatballs, chicken wings and a slice of lasagna.  Delicious!

text: Enjoyed being back at the Tropicana (I spent time there in the 90's) It was good to see that some of the former Ballys Casino staff, had migrated down beach. . . My room proximity to the Casino was great. Very pleased with the North Tower. Once I figured out, how to get to the 5üåüGilchrist for breakfast. It was during that walk, in the early mornings. I had the chance to observe the Cleaning Crews, and their attention to detail. Hand rails, escalators, elevators, corners of window sills, spotless. . . And the pool I passed at the Chelsea Tower looked so inviting and clean. . . I was Loving once again, my "New" Favorite AC Casino. . . Since merging with Caesars Rewards & Loyalty Program. . . *Update*. . . I want to Thank the Casino Staff for all they do. . . Fran the Floor Manager, is such a gentleman and professional. Big Ed V. Floor Supervisor also a gentlemen and professional, has the ability to make everyone feel welcome and appreciated. . . Sharp dresser and great sense of humor. . . It takes a special talent, to deal with some of these players, when they have been drinking all night. . . I want to recognize some of my favorite Table Games Dealers. Michael, who has been at the Tropicana since it was built. Paul also has been here almost as long. And George another long time employee who is fun, helpful, and hilarious. . . I'm looking forward to seeing them all, on my next trip. . .

text:
Stayed at the north tower with my boyfriend back in September. There was a horrible storm those two days so couldn‚Äôt venture around AC much but we still had a lot of fun as there is plenty of things to do in the resort.

Room/cleanliness: I‚Äôm a smoker (horrible- I know) so I appreciated there being smoking rooms and smoking areas in the casino so I didn‚Äôt need to go out in the wind & rain just to have a smoke.
The room was in a convenient location. Right above the casino and near the elevators. Our window view was overlooking the casino which was pretty cool. The furniture was a little dated and the cleaning was ehh but that‚Äôs pretty much the case with all smoking rooms in any hotel/resort.

Casino: clean. I saw several employees doing detailed cleaning while playing the slots.

Parking: If staying in the North tower, I recommend using the valet. It was very convenient and the charge for it wasn‚Äôt much.

Staff: no complaints about the Tropicana staff. All very friendly and helpful.

Location: perfect location to the boardwalk and beach. I definitely recommend The Rain Forest Cafe located on the boardwalk.

My only 2 complaints (one was my fault).
1.  was our experience at Hooters there. From the moment we walked in the door, the waitress was very rude. Maybe she was having a bad day but it seemed like she took one look at us and assumed we wouldn‚Äôt tip well (we tip a standard 20-30% (depending on service which I think is very fair). We were nothing but kind to her but she was still extremely rude. The other waitress walking around seemed delightful, I wish she was our waitress instead.
Complaint 2: we went during the week days in the fall so the pools weren‚Äôt open. That‚Äôs my bad for not seeing that in their website. So if you want to use a pool, double check the pools are open.
I think all the bad reviews were from people expecting it to be a five star hotel. Most said there wasn‚Äôt much signage for locations but if you look up, there are signs with arrows pointing where to go.

Over all, we had a great time and definitely plan to be back soon! Thank you for helping making our vacay a good one!
