completion:
Stayed at the north tower with my boyfriend back in September. There was a horrible storm those two days so couldn‚Äôt venture around AC much but we still had a lot of fun as there is plenty of things to do in the resort.

Room/cleanliness: I‚Äôm a smoker (horrible- I know) so I appreciated there being smoking rooms and smoking areas in the casino so I didn‚Äôt need to go out in the wind & rain just to have a smoke.
The room was in a convenient location. Right above the casino and near the elevators. Our window view was overlooking the casino which was pretty cool. The furniture was a little dated and the cleaning was ehh but that‚Äôs pretty much the case with all smoking rooms in any hotel/resort.

Casino: clean. I saw several employees doing detailed cleaning while playing the slots.

Parking: If staying in the North tower, I recommend using the valet. It was very convenient and the charge for it wasn‚Äôt much.

Staff: no complaints about the Tropicana staff. All very friendly and helpful.

Location: perfect location to the boardwalk and beach. I definitely recommend The Rain Forest Cafe located on the boardwalk.

My only 2 complaints (one was my fault).
1.  was our experience at Hooters there. From the moment we walked in the door, the waitress was very rude. Maybe she was having a bad day but it seemed like she took one look at us and assumed we wouldn‚Äôt tip well (we tip a standard 20-30% (depending on service which I think is very fair). We were nothing but kind to her but she was still extremely rude. The other waitress walking around seemed delightful, I wish she was our waitress instead.
Complaint 2: we went during the week days in the fall so the pools weren‚Äôt open. That‚Äôs my bad for not seeing that in their website. So if you want to use a pool, double check the pools are open.
I think all the bad reviews were from people expecting it to be a five star hotel. Most said there wasn‚Äôt much signage for locations but if you look up, there are signs with arrows pointing where to go.

Over all, we had a great time and definitely plan to be back soon! Thank you for helping making our vacay a good one!

text: Some rooms are just ok...and some rooms and suites are very good. No room service but some of the restaurants in the building deliver. Hotel convenience store carries no booze but there's a decent liquor store 7 min walk in the Trop mall area. Staff is ok...but not great. Could use a few more gambling tables available. Only one for Let It Ride and its usually full. Recommend Boogie Nights nightclub for club fun. A few dance floors and some great older music with a great sound system.

I was coughing and sneezing alot. My eyes were itching. So as i started to investigate the room my sheets were dirty. The walls had black drippings rolling down the entire room walls. Maybe water stains but it was yucky! I had a double bed room . The water burned my skin and is difficult to get it to the right temperture. My phone fell and upon pulling the beds  out i saw so much yuck which explains why my allergies were all over the place. The tv was dusty. Towels had burn marks and more. Not to mention I had a groupon that states the promotional value never expires. But everyone acted like they had no idea what i was presenting in front of them so I never got to use it. One supervisor said "hang tight we are starting another groupon soon". Just sad! Im very annoyed with the service. I stayed two nights tuesday and thursday and both rooms were distguisting!

text: The RV park is small, well maintained, right on the water, and the site we had included full hookups. I absolutely agree with other reviews that the road noise is significant and that site #14 is only appropriate for a smaller RV.  We were able to back into #14 with a 20' trailer, I cannot imagine doing it with anything larger. It seemed that several of the concrete pads were not level, we noticed an RV with both of its front tires off the ground after being leveled. We enjoyed kayaking but found strong and irregular currents in front of the PUD building. We didn't notice any real beach, but maybe the tides were off while we were there. We were able to launch kayaks from the bottom of some rock steps. It's a great spot, really well kept and we will be back!

text:
We finished off the decade with three nights in the RV portion of the Waterfront offering, and enjoyed it immensely.  We parked less than 10 yards from the water with a great view.  The water here is so clear you can see the bottom like looking through glass. Even when wind whipped up some small waves you could see through the waves to the rocky bottom.

The facilities have very nice and clean showers, and a commons room you can gather in for a game. The road is close and busy through the day, but traffic dies off through the evening and it is very peaceful.

text: Great location, recently remodeled, stayed in a two bedroom cabin. The cabins have all the basic cooking tools you will need, the dishes are set for 4 persons, so might want to bring extras (paper/plastic), else you will be running the dishwasher a lot. The view is great, staff very friendly and helpful. Note: the cabins are close to the highway, you may consider earplugs in the bedroom if highway sounds are an issue. Some of my RV friends said the same. There are fire pits and picnic tables. The cabins have a couple chairs and a small table. It fine to smoke on the deck. We'll be back next year

text:
Had a great dining experience here. Stopped by after a long day in Battle Creek to find this classic dining location in Marshal. Old world style with rough finished beams that have great quotes painted on them.
Our server did not hurry us, but set us up with drinks and their house made flat bread and cheese spread. The cheese spread was a great throw back to my childhood! Next was the roasted brussel sprouts.  Followed by their prime rib, Turkey (!) shepard's pie, and burger. Very pleasantly surprised by the Turkey shepard's pie - a nice twist on a classic. The prime rib was perfect and classic. Give them a try!

text:
Fantastic location for a short trip around Mt. Shasta.

Our first ever stay here. There are cheaper lodges too in the area but our risk appetite was limited, hence went for this one with higher security and better arrangement in terms of breakfast and room quality.

I just wish they could have provided housekeeping service too since we spent more than just one night. I remember how during pre-covid times the hotel rooms in any place used to be cleaned and well arranged each day by the time you were back. Miss that luxury!

Breakfast isn't a buffet. That also surprised me. They have a standard list of 6-7 entres and you have to choose your breakfast from it. Us being vegetarians had limited options and repeated the same thing the next day. It was, however, delicious. Lovvvedd the hot chocolate with whipped cream.

If there had been fruits, bread, juices, muffins and things like that as a buffet I could have adjusted the quantity and variety.

text: Not a luxury 5 star hotel, however i am not aware of any accommodations in the area that are. If your looking for a mountain lodge feeling, this is the place! Conveniently located with only about a 20 minute drive to Mt Shasta Ski Park. They DO NOT have the traditional free breakfast, however they do have a restaurant onsite. Also have a bar and grill. Food is a little spend but good, as expected for hotel restaurants. They were short staffed but the waitresses did their best and were very polite and accommodating. We decided to stay an extra night on a holiday weekend and while booked, the manager Joe pulled through for us and got us an extension. All of the staff work hard and are very polite. Hopefully some hotel upgrades/remodels are planned for the near future. If you plan to stay, suggest you book early, this is the go to for skiers and hikers and it fills up fast!

The restaurant is a bit old and the furniture is pretty broken down. I sunk into my seat about 3 inches! The food was pretty disappointing too...medium steak (at over $30!) Came out cold and raw. Could not send it back because the ONE server was completely overwhelmed with tables. That said...her service and attitude considering the situation was incredible! She really tried very hard to get to everyone.
It's probably a great place to being kids...nice outdoor courtyards between the buildings and little waterfalls.  There is an indoor pool that looked pretty decent.
With all the disappointment aside, the staff at this hotel is just...WOW!  From the front desk to the maintenance and housekeeping folks...every one of them was super friendly, kind and professional!

text:
For a view of Mount Shasta, this place was one of the best in town. It was centrally located, within walking distance to most of the restaurants in town. The rooms itself could use some freshening up, not really outdated, just looked a little tired. Couldn't tell if the refrigerator in the room was working, didn't seem to get particularly cold and there was no adjustment. The restaurant was good but do yourself a favor and DO NOT PURCHASE THE PRE PAID BREAKFAST PACKAGE. They charge you $20 per person for breakfast. You get your choice of one entree and one drink. My wife ordered the Granola and coffee and wanted a bagel. She was told that she would have to pay extra for the bagel even though the total with the bagel wasn't over $20. You're better off paying as you go because you don't get the difference if your total is under $20. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, our stay was ok, I'd stay here again if I were in town but I wouldn't pre pay for breakfast again.

Just got a response from Best Western. They state that their breakfast package are $10 for adults and $5 for children. Going through Bookings.com we were charged $20 per person. Our total for breakfast for the 5 days we were there was $200. I will say breakfast was good but not $200 good. And at no time were our meals over $20 but we didn't get the difference back

Special thanks to Rodrigo for helping us with our stay so we could attend the event we booked our stay for. Photos are of moon lit sea at sandy beach.

text: Great place, semi family with a little adult on the side. Has walkout villas which we stayed in and condos. Villa -10 is personally owned and configured differently but has same layout as other villas. Huge tall living, large baths, large rooms. Lots of space inside. Sit on a Lawn chair and and do activities on the turf grass out back. They provide most everything but would recommend more toilet paper, sand chairs per person, shade if you want it. How you rocky point - bring loads of food, prepare with a Costco run, condiments and snacks and good food. Then mess up the dinner plans by instead of preparing it, go into town for tacos.

text:
Ummm I probably wouldn‚Äôt come here because of the security, they were super strict, couldn‚Äôt do much but then again it‚Äôs their job, but they made us feel uncomfortable. We booked on Expedia which then brought me to Virbo and I had to create an account and the owners name is Tom. It was a little confusing but figured it out.
The apartment was very spacious and clean,to bedrooms and a set of bunk beds, it had everything you need such as laundry soap, condiments, utensils, plates etc. So we were able to grocery shop for the week.
When you go to the pool, the kiddie pool is not warm and there is an adult pool for night. The beach is beautiful but there is always a low tide so you will have to walk a little to get to the water.
The town is not fully developed, so don‚Äôt expect a Cancun experience but you will find authentic Mexican food when you drive into the town.
In the tourist area of Puerto Penasco, they sell very expensive souvenirs, charging in American prices. Don‚Äôt forget to try the Oyster farm! 100 pesos for one dozen oysters

text:
This is arguably the best sushi in Easton (maybe even the shore)! I've tried all the others and I keep coming back. The staff is friendly and always asks about my family when I come in alone. The wait for food is never long, even if the place is full. You can dine in at lunch and get back to work quick. The menu items consistently taste amazing and are prepared the same way everytime... there are no surprises, if you order an Olympic roll it's going to be amazing Every Single Time, and that surely can not be said for the other places in town. Some of my favorites are "Amazing Tuna" "Jingle Bell" "Olympic" "Incredible" and "spicey crab" but all of them are good. If you go between 12 and 4 the special is "get 1 special roll and get a second at half off". Oh, and their unsweetened tea is the best in town, I know that's a small thing but it matters to me since I've given up soda.

If you're looking for a great place to have Sushi in Easton look no farther than usushi!

text: If you are looking to stay at a top-notch hotel. The Best Western Premier Bridgewood (Neenah) is an excellent choice. Our family of 4 stayed here recently while on our family vacation and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which is a must for us with two teenagers. Each of the kids had their own bed in their own room, we had a separate room with a king bed and there was also a spacious family room. Three 65 inch tvs in each space kept everyone entertained during our downtime. The room was clean, nice and spacious. The hotel itself was very clean and nice in all areas. The pool is nicer than average hotel pools featuring a shallow wading pool for small children and main pool with basketball hoop and a larger slide for older kids. Two hot tubs one indoors and one outside were nice and relaxing. On site restaurant was very good and convenient to get to within the hotel. After our stay we received an emailed survey and personal response letter from the hotel manager thanking us. We would definitely stay here again.

text:
NOT WORTH THE COST!!!
Save your money, and use the $25 for something that is more than 10 mins long. Also for $75 we could have   had hours worth of fun some where else in the city rather than 10 mins.

Is it a fun experience for children ages 3 to 12, yes! If money is NOT a worry for you then go and enjoy yourself. Our child had a great time for the 15 mins. However, $25 for adults and children is absolutely ridiculous. At BEST this is should cost $12 for adults $5 for children.

The only reason they can get away with charging such an absurd price is because it is in Faneuil Hall.

Our daughter had a great time. But for 10-15 mins of walking around for $25 is INSANE.

text:
Main takeaways: not worth the price, but the kids did have fun. The exhibit was small, very warm (no ac even in Summer), and the main thing is that the dinosaurs appear to be inflatable? And in very poor condition (missing teeth, hair and feathers missing in large patches, sections of the inflatable not working etc.) the lighting is also very low and odd. It seems designed to be scary and colorful maybe, instead of actually being able to see any detailing on the creatures. I paid $25 per person (including the kids) and you can see the exhibit in 15-20 minutes (reading all of the educational material). It just isn‚Äôt worth it.

The only reason this isn‚Äôt a 1 star or a complaint to the organization for a refund, is that the kids did have fun. The dinosaurs are touchable (probably why they are in such terrible condition). And there is an interactive coloring program at the end that is pretty good (but even that was glitchy.)

text: Probably the coolest way to make/show off a bunch of aquariums! They've got just about anything you could need on a few nicely organized walls & a very knowledgeable, friendly staff to help you out! I went there to get some water-turtle (Red Eared Slider) safe plants for my 30gal tank & they had a TON of diff plant species to pick through <^¬∑^> They have a big area outside with mostly red-eared slider turtles in it..which i would guess might be from people who aren't able to keep their turtles once they start getting bigger :S (sadly a common occurrence with the adorable baby sliders since they're SO easy to find in TX & not everybody getting them is well informed on their care or needs to keep them healthy. )

text: There are 2 stores in Austin that you should buy fish. The Aquadome if you're south of downtown or Aquatech if you are north. The aquadome has hundreds of both salt and fresh water fish, coral, live rocks and sand, crustaceans, outdoor ponds and fish, and every type of supplies you would need. Prices are great and the staff is both knowledgable and friendly. Pro-tip... buy the loyalty card. Best 20 bucks you can spend if you are a fish hobbyist.

text:
Simply the best fish store I've ever been to.

Absolutely wonderful selection, amazing quality of corals and fish. Huge freshwater and dry goods selection too.

Picked up 9 frags and they're all healthy and lovely. Massive selection too with very competitive pricing. I'll be getting all my coral here from now on!

Staff was very helpful, didn't rush while I was picking stuff out and packaged it all well. The guy who helped me check out informed me of their club benefits and that's its own fantastic benefit.

10/10 experience.

text:
At best, I'm a novice at the aquarium hobby. I've been setting up an aquarium and navigating all the intricacies that comes with setting up a new aquarium. In doing so, a social media aquarium hobby group recommended the Austin Aqua Dome as a solid, local hub for hobbyists. During my visit, I was greeted and invited to ask any questions I might have.

The building calls back to the "Keep Austin Weird" idea in both supporting a local business *and* being a wonderfully unique shopping experience in offering an infinite collection of aquarium related materiel to purchase- from fresh water to salt/marine, from ponds, to desktop bowls and extravagant custom aquariums. My overall experience was akin to me being a kid going on a great field trip like a previous visitor mentioned in their review.

Though I am still waiting to introduce fish to my aquarium, I was able to have questions answered about different live plants suitable to my experience and want for the type of fish community I'll eventually be keeping. I was introduced to a myriad of different plant varieties and they had a wonderfully diverse set of options to choose from. I ended up purchasing 5 plants of two different kinds and a wonderful piece of prepared driftwood for my setup. I also bought a plant solution to introduce and maintain for my water that promotes growth. Finally, because I look to continue my business relationship with Austin Aqua Dome, I purchased a one year membership that will likely pay for itself as my odyssey into this passtime grows. High fives all around and I can't wait to go back again and, if my S.O. doesn't kill me, maybe start a 2nd aquarium in the near future!

text:
This place was better than I expected. Very very comfy and cozy. I slept wonderfully listening to the rolling water of the salmon river every night! The river is literally right behind the back balcony or porch. We were upstairs and had an incredible view of the river, the mountains and even a couple of elk that came down to drink water from the river.
We reserved a room with two Queen beds and a room with a king. Both rooms were great, but the king room was extra special for my wife and I. We loved it. I would have even enjoyed sleeping on the balcony! Hahahahahaha!
When I first called to ask a few questions regarding making reservations there, the wonderful lady that helped me went above and beyond what I was expecting. I booked a room immediately. Later on that day, I booked a second room. The pricing was way better than I expected. The service was way better than I expected. The rooms were way better than I expected. And the view was beautiful! I promise that I will be back again! It was a beautiful winter and our first time in Stanley

prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.

text:
Typically I am quite skeptical about these corporate run places or attractions like this. Especially when they're located in a mall or something of that fashion. In my opinion they tend to be more of a gimmick than an actual fun and educational experience.
That being said, you should also know that if you're expecting something like one of those very large public aquariums that everyone raves about, this very much isn't that in any way shape or form (and that's okay). It is however much larger than what you might be anticipating if you're basing things on how the outside of the building looks.

I say all of that, to say this. Even though this place isn't of the caliber of many major city aquariums, it does have to some great qualities for what it is. I wound up here because my Fianc√© and I decided it would be a good weekend adventure for the kids, and as it turned out, we were right.

One of the major perks right off the bat is the fact that they often are only taking guests that buy tickets in advance (at least this was the case while we were there), meaning it is much less busy than it would be if they were letting everyone walk up and buy tickets. I feel that this really made for a less congested and more personal experience with the kids.

I don't know exactly what I was expecting for the price of a ticket here, but I do feel like it was absolutely worth it, not only for the kids, but for the adults as well. There were certain periods throughout the experience that I think I was probably more excited to see a certain animal than my ten year old son was. The way this place is set up is basically you're in an undersea maze where you continue on, learning about and seeing all sorts of creatures, eventually ending up at the end (a.k.a the gift shop). There are also parts where you're able to interact and be hands on with certain sea creatures, and that was pretty entertaining as well.

There are not only quite a few creatures (both salt and freshwater) to take a gander at but also several activities for the kids to take part in during the whole experience. This place also makes it incredibly easy to be able to see everything no matter how big or small you are (you'll see what I mean when you walk through). You might even get the opportunity to see several of the creatures eat, which can be quite fascinating. Specifically the Stingrays, I mean have you ever seen a Stingray eat? Probably not, and you totally have the ability to here.

When all is said and done, should this act as a replacement for those gigantic public aquariums that many cities have? Absolutely not, but oftentimes not everyone has access to those places or those specific aquariums, and this would probably be the next best thing in my opinion.
The staff here is also friendly, professional, and seemingly quite knowledgeable about the sea creatures they keep, which was refreshing to see.
I truly believe that if you can separate the fact that you're not going to get the full "aquarium" experience that you might get at those other very well known gigantic aquariums, then you can truly have a great time here, especially if you bring the kids.

Buy your tickets ahead of time, and have a great time. Wander around the mall afterwards, what do you have to lose?

text: Excellent food and service highlight this wonderful restaurant on the north side of Columbus!  I was recently visiting family and we decided to go to Nicola for a nice quiet dinner.  It was later on a Saturday night and after we had placed our orders we were pleasantly surprised when our server not only brought some bread, but a nice bruschetta appetizer, as well, and he explained it was on the house since they were low on bread.  I went with the lasagna, as I also do, on my first visit to an Italian restaurant and it did not disappoint.  We had also ordered a beef carpaccio appetizer for the table that was quite excellent.  We capped off the meal with an exquisite rendition of tiramisu, that proved to be a delicious finale to our dining experience.  I highly recommend this restaurant and am definitely looking forward to my next visit!

text:
Came here originally on my birthday last year . The food is just amazing. The chef / owner is from Italy and knows how to cook. The homemade pastas were amazing , the staff knew what kind of wine my wife needed , as their wine menu was very overwhelming. Huge wine menu lol .

My wife wanted come back on Valentine‚Äôs Day weekend on a Saturday , and it was such a lovey experience ..... we started with the fried calamari. It was crunchy and tender. Got a nice $30 of Cabernet and it was smooth. I don‚Äôt really drink wine but I was able to drink a whole bottle with wifey . Next we got a shrimp / crab dish and 4 cheese ravioli. Outstanding entrees. Didn‚Äôt look like much but we were very stuffed . Last was our lime something cake ....

We did come at 8pm so the crowd died down so our service was pretty spot on .

Love love love this place !

***updates*** 12/21/2020

Just came here on a Monday for my bday and it was perfect ! When we got there at 6pm there was only us and another table. We practically had the restaurant for a good 30 minutes to ourselves . Usually this place is packed but probably due to covid it has slowed down. They closed their larger dining area. We had a bottle of wine , few appetizers , and two main courses ! Our food was awesome ! And service was great ! Wish it was busier so the restaurant stays in business.

Apps
Caprese
Carpaccio
Meatballs

Main dish
Fettuccini w mushrooms / shrimp /scallops
Piccata chicken w spaghetti?

text: This was our anniversary and we wanted to celebrate with fine tasting Italian food. This was it! Outside on their patio, sipping a tasty, tart cocktail and a nice Barbera red. We love caprese and adding basil pesto is a keeper. The Tuscan Nido was perfect-handmade and hands down the largest ravioli-the added surprise of an egg yolk hidden inside was genius! The Filetto Di Maiale(pork tenderloin) was perfectly cooked and the flavor was mouth watering, even as I ate it! We wrapped it up with their lemon cake. Oh, man, so light and lemony. We took smaller and smaller bites so it would last longer. Give them a go, we‚Äôll certainly be back!

text: Excellent service, friendly staff, huge wine list and tasty food. We had a great bottle of Chianti. Then we split the calamari and caprese. The calamari was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all. I saw the guy in the kitchen breading it. The caprese was honestly one of the best I've had. Being winter, the tomato wasn't the best but the mozzarella was perfect. It was topped with a delicious pesto. And the plate was drizzled with the thickest balsamic glaze I've ever had. It was almost like caramel. The balsamic glaze was extremely flavorful. For our main courses, we had the Tuscan Nido and the wild mushroom Tagliatelle. The Tuscan Nido was basically a giant ravioli. The filling had great flavor. I loved the pops of whole peppercorn and the fried sage leaves. The pasta was clearly homemade and perfect. The wild mushroom Tagliatelle was even better. The mushroom flavor was amazing and the smell was just divine. Normally, I would have liked to see the addition of truffle to a dish like this but honestly, I think it was near perfect without. The mushrooms just had such good flavor. To top off our meal, the lady who seated us came around to see how our meal was. Based on our conversation, I assume she was the owner. She was incredibly sweet. We will be back.

text:
Cute restaurant! We got our own little corner behind curtain, it was quite perfect for a group of loud kids and adults.

Meatballs and the sauces were very good!!! The other entrees portions are all too big. Seafood risotto was not bad, I would prefer the seafood not cooked so much that they were a bit chewy.

We all laughed over the one giant piece of ravioli, that was not expected. It smelled really good and was told that it tasted very good too.

They have a large menu of wine by glass and by bottle. Cocktail menu was pretty standard.

I would prefer here than any other chain restaurant, but there are also much better Italian out there.

text:
Today my family and I arrived at Golden Corral in Sterling Heights Michigan and were extremely disgusted with what we saw.

After paying (over $60) we finally found a table that was clean. When we went to the bar, we saw nothing but food thrown all over the floor, the bar was disgustingly dirty, and completely empty. Servers and the manager were just walking through the food all over the floor, never cleaning anything at all. It was so bad, I decided to take photos as well for you.

After sitting down, it took us 15 minutes to get silverware, and over 25 min to get drinks. Our server never cleared the plates from our table when needed either.

As for at the bar; the woman doing the steaks was more interested in flirting and trying to get a date with a customer than actually helping customers, cleaning anything, or even putting steaks on the grill. The salad bar was basically full of rotting fruit and slimy lettuce.

At the desert bar, there was chicken on the floor, food everywhere. My biggest concern was the fact that there were peanuts all over the bar, mixed into other toppings, on the cookies, on the brownies, etc. As someone with an extreme nut allergy, this type of cross contamination is deadly, let alone disgusting.

For $60 my family and I ate one plate of food that was cold by the time we got our silverware because the bar was empty and never refilled. I understand that places may be short staffed but that is not an excuse for any of this. If the health department would have walked in, the place would have been closed immediately‚Ä¶.and honestly should have. When the manager, the staff, the servers, and guests are having to walk through food on the floor and nothing is being cleaned or refilled, that‚Äôs awful. We have been here several times and this is the most disgusting restaurant I have ever seen.

The photos shown below are just some of the photos I took. The entire restaurant was like this.
title: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill
prompt: A Google Maps review about a buffet restaurant.

text:
Would highly recommend this great little Campground. The property was clean, very well kept, and had everything you could need. Play Set for kids, cozy tent & RV sites, coin operated showers, laundry, dishwashing station and even a place for fishermen to clean their catch. Convenient store with the basics as well as some handmade goods and local foods. The quaint little grill in the back makes a mean burger and has tons of food options. I enjoyed the seafood basket which was plentiful (shrimp, clam, scallops & fries).
Everyone we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. The only downside I might mention is that there is only of toilet and one shower for the whole park. We came in the off season, so this was no big deal. Not sure what it would be like in the busy season.
Overall a great place and we loved our stay! Will be returning for sure! Location is key and this place is perfectly situated between, Rialto Beach, La Push, Forks, & the Hoh. Didn‚Äôt hurt that they fully embrace the Twilight mania that has over taken this area either. I was here for the National Park, but am also a Twilight fan, so I really enjoyed all the little Twilight touches they had. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

text: You will miss your bed at home real quick! The only thing keeping me from giving a two star or worse rating was the fantastic customer service: front desk, housekeeping, and the breakfast attendant. Otherwise this Hilton-brand Hampton Inn and Suites is not worth the higher price point than many of the other options in Aberdeen and is way overdue for a refresh (maybe we can blame Covid-19). The colors and finishes in the lobby, halls and rooms are dinged, scuffed and just plain ugly. The king-sized bed in our non-suite room was caving in and needing replacement. When booking, be aware not all the rooms are like the pictures on the site, some are very plain with no kitchenette, just an awkward mini fridge and microwave by the desk in the room. No real dresser if you like to unpack just a small hutch with sticking drawers that the TV sits on. Pull out style love seat sofa seemed like a great option for the kids, but the window was very drafty and our son about froze the first night. The blankets were very thin waffle weave style. We asked for a second for the next night and he put on extra clothes and was okay. Not comfortable enough for an adult, he slept on it backwards, because even he could feel the metal. The bathroom was a good size which was nice for a family traveling with younger kids, but the bathroom fixtures were loose and the shower almost didn't work. The toilet took several flushes. The pillows in our room weren't the usual mixture of firm and soft (feather and polyfill as it turned out for here), but housekeeping brought us new ones when we inquired at the front desk during breakfast. The breakfast was quite good. Many choices, including an oatmeal area with fixings, plus other hot options, waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, biscuits and gravy one morning and the next eggs and sausage patties. Coffee options were hot. Pool and hot tub area was small, but we had fun anyways. Pool towels were restocked regularly. Elevator floor became sticky one evening, but as we were in and out, right away they had it mopped I noticed. Again, great customer service that way. We also did laundry which was weirdly on the second floor off in the corner, kinda creepy, but washing and each dry cycle was just a dollar in quarters. Front desk had change.

text: MOLD AND TERRIBLE HOUSEKEEPING!!! Front desk has great customer service. Kayla was very attentive and has great customer service. I stayed ten nights and housekeeping would show up every other day. I had to do my own bed, and take out my trash on the days that no one would show up. On the days that they showed up it was around 4 PM and in a bad mood. I talked to a manager by the name of Kyle three times and he did nothing about it. My shower was never cleaned even though I mentioned to the housekeeping lady that I had mold in the shower. I stay at Hampton Inn‚Äôs all the time and this is definitely the worst house keeping in the country. They should win a Golden Globe Broom for the worst housekeeping service.

text:
Had a nice experience the park wasn‚Äôt as crowded as expected. There were times you‚Äôd have to wait to talk to characters or participate in activities. And a few things were extra. The build your own adventure style park was fun and has tons of room to expand and grow in the future! I‚Äôm excited to see the park grow and expand in future years!

That said they do need to expand some aspects of the park like having a more consistent schedule. The magic act and last circus show we attended on Thursday night was super short and was missing performers. Schedules need to be met and consistency needs to be seen in these. Also some sort of established system of barter and trade consistency would be nice to see. You can earn gold during Lore (2021) and trade it but it was hard to figure out who would take it and what they had to trade without time consuming interactions with several different people even a little sign saying gold traded here or something of the like would have been nice.

text:
We had an amazing time and we enjoyed the food and appreciated the whole experience.
Our dinner started with complementary bread and butter. After that, we had a salad with a delicious dressing.
Our main course was a dish of quail in special wild mushrooms sauce, a dish of a rack of lamb which I highly recommended, a dish of snapper with homemade cajun spice, and the venison on the cherry port sauce.
For dessert, we had this delicious tiramisu.
Magdy the owner is a very skilled chef and a friendly welcoming person.
This place is one of the best places for me.
Highly recommended and it‚Äôs better to call before you go.

text: Do NOT judge from the outside, although I can see why you might. We took a chance and we were blown away. It was a very quaint and nicely decorated restaurant.  It had white linen tablecloths and napkins, nice music and everything was very clean. They had a nice wine list and we ordered some chardonnay as an appetizer....and then an actual appetizer. For the main fare we ordered beef wellington and chicken caprese. The food was absolutely delicious! Chef Magdy came out and spoke with us. He was absolutely charming!! He comped us free desserts, which were also delicious, and made us feel like we were eating with an old friend. We dressed for the occasion, but it is not necessary at all. It's a very comfortable, fine dining experience. Give it a try.

text:
NiteHawk is the best place around to play scenario paintball / woodsball / Req. Which is saying something because what few choices we do have in the area are all great! NiteHawk management is excellent and always willing to help as are the field regulars.
They offer decent rental equipment so you can bring your buddy, or for yourself if you're not convinced to make the investment in your own gear.
They offer food, and drinks at the field at fair prices and the field paint is reasonably priced also. NiteHawk is a passion project for the owner and regulars that come here and this is one of the things that make it special IMO. There is a sense of community at NiteHawk, and it's just an absolute blast  to go out and play paintball here.

text: What a great Park! After living in KY for 6+ years and realizing we had never been to this state park, we decided it was past time to check it out... and I'm so glad we did! The lodge rooms are a bit dated, but clean with private porches overlooking the trees. The hiking trails and cave tours are AWESOME, though. No pictures can do these justice. We checked out both X-Cave and Cascade Cave, as well as a couple different trails. It was a bit rainy / cloudy when we visited, so we'll definitely be back to do more hiking when the weather is better!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park
prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion: What a great Park! After living in KY for 6+ years and realizing we had never been to this state park, we decided it was past time to check it out... and I'm so glad we did! The lodge rooms are a bit dated, but clean with private porches overlooking the trees. The hiking trails and cave tours are AWESOME, though. No pictures can do these justice. We checked out both X-Cave and Cascade Cave, as well as a couple different trails. It was a bit rainy / cloudy when we visited, so we'll definitely be back to do more hiking when the weather is better!

text: A great place if you love the outdoors. 30 miles of hiking, rock climbing and repelling, biking, kayaking, awesome cave tours, horseback riding and nature lovers. Campground packed on weekends in summer but quiet midweek. Outer edge sites woodsy and most are a decent size.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park
prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion: A great place if you love the outdoors. 30 miles of hiking, rock climbing and repelling, biking, kayaking, awesome cave tours, horseback riding and nature lovers. Campground packed on weekends in summer but quiet midweek. Outer edge sites woodsy and most are a decent size.

text: This is obviously a much smaller cave system and park than mammoth caves.  However mammoth caves while impressive due to size doesn't really have quite as much cave feel to it because of that size... That being said these are not claustrophobic caves that make you crawl on your hands and knees it's just most areas are closer to a standard hallway with larger rooms scattered here and there.  I enjoyed this trip more than I thought.

text: We really enjoyed the X-cave and Cascade cave tours. My 10 and 9 year old sons preferred the X cave as their favorite   due to it being narrower and trickier to navigate through. Made them feel like real explorers, and they got to get closer to the rock formations. We also enjoyed the hike to Natural Bridge. A little secret we discovered... if you walk down to the creek behind the welcome center and follow it about a quarter mile downstream, you'll find where the creek passes into a cave through the mountain side. Bring a flashlight because there are no tour guides waiting to take you through this one.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park
prompt: A Google Maps review about a resort hotel.
completion: We really enjoyed the X-cave and Cascade cave tours. My 10 and 9 year old sons preferred the X cave as their favorite   due to it being narrower and trickier to navigate through. Made them feel like real explorers, and they got to get closer to the rock formations. We also enjoyed the hike to Natural Bridge. A little secret we discovered... if you walk down to the creek behind the welcome center and follow it about a quarter mile downstream, you'll find where the creek passes into a cave through the mountain side. Bring a flashlight because there are no tour guides waiting to take you through this one.

text:
The rooms are great. Occasional ant, fly etc.- but you should expect that in a lodge near woods. The room felt clean. The balcony is wonderful. Only thing I missed was my pillows. Their pillows are not the greatest. So you may want to bring your own. We were there on a weekday, so the restaurant didn't stay open as late. But we were still able to order pizza and have it delivered. Tyler's Pizza is AMAZING. You have access to the campground pool. We didn't do this though. The food we had at lunch in the lodge restaurant was great. The waitress was a very charming, young blonde. Very sweet.
The cave tours were super easy to sign up for. Took like 2 mins. We took the Cascades tour and we were fortunate to get to do the Ghost and Legends tour which was a lantern tour of the Saltpeter Cave (a portion) and the X Cave by Mason. The lantern tour was SUPER cool. Highly recommend. Wish there was a way to tip your tour guides. They do great. We also took a hike on the 3 bridge trail. (3.8 miles I think)
Beautiful scenery. Wish there were markers saying how much further you had. It's hard to keep track when you have a tour later in the day.  Overall, this is good for a day/ 1 overnight trip. We did everything we wanted to do almost in a day. The park is well taken care of. If we had stayed another night, boredom could set in. So I recommend this for a quick, short getaway.

text:
So it's very confusing but we stayed at the Carter Caves Campground not the resort or cabins.
We arrived one day early figured we would try our luck. We were met on the office by a disinterested kid. Once we got through that, we discovered that our sight #8, had the electric pedestal aprox 75' from the site.
We returned to the office and were moved to sight #3. Once we backed in, we discovered that the electric pedestal had 20 or 50 Amp. No 30.
Back again and moved into #6. It worked but I had to back all the way to the end of the pad and my power cord just made it.
Water took two hoses to reach and had to wrap to the opposite side of the camper.
We had a nice view but the picnic table was not usable due the the slope.
The showers were ok but the curtain bottom was covered with mold.
Overall a busy Campground, dogs and some guy in a tow truck that liked to let everyone know he had an air horn.
The park overall was beautiful and the hiking was great!
Just be warned to really look over the registration as it's not your typical campgroud.

text: Such a fun place! Tons of trails of varied difficulty. It's a lot better in the summer than fall/winter because leaves obscure the trails so it's easy to go the wrong way in the colder seasons. You'll need a caving permit to actually explore the caves or take one of the guided tours. We really like the amount of trails you can go to and there's enough open space that you don't feel like you're hiking right on top of another group.

text:
Went to Carter Caves to watch the magician Mike and dinner for Valentines.  I highly recommend.  The dinner was booked by tables, you went downstairs by tables then to the buffet so there was no mad rush or long lines.
The buffet was great and had three entree choices, chicken, prime rib and something else.  A good sale, mashed taters, Brussels sprouts, green beans and rolls were other choices.  The desert bar had chocolate candies, strawberries covered in chocolate, cupcakes, banana pudding and a chocolate cake so yummy.
Mike the magician made the event interactive and the made the night fun.  I laughed until my jaws hurt.  We had a good time.

text:
Why Eagle Harbor is the place you want to stay when in Door County?
Eagle Harbor is located right accross the bay and walking distance to Penninsula State Park. When we entered the property it was beautifully places homes giving you a royal feel of a town. The homes B&Bs are well kept and looks eye pleasing. Upon checking in the host was very friendly and informative about door county. They made us feel home. He check us in and off we went to our room Tilla. Tilla was the 1st room up the stairs on your left. Room was rather small but well designed and very cozy. The antique looks gave it a very stylish english look. The washroom was large enough and had a sky light to it. B&B main building was well decorated (pics attached) and well kept. This beautiful B&B was one of the best we have visited so far. Their breakfast was really good with some freshly baked chocolate Croissant, Cherry Yogurt, Juices Cereals and much more. Their toiletery items were good as well. Very good smelling and nice in quality. This was the best experince for us we felt right at home. Coziest B&B ever. Don't wait make your bookings right now.

text:
Unfortunately I don‚Äôt have anything good to say about Gaia house . When we were sat down there was paint bubbling near us, probably due to moisture trapped behind the paint. And then a leak above. It‚Äôs not really an appetizing sight.

We were told that we wouldn‚Äôt be able to have espresso or lattes because the espresso machine was down. That‚Äôs fine. What I did take issue with was the self serve coffee station. For one, the way the glasses were stored was gross. The shelves were not clean. The cups were freshly washed. I could tell because they were wet, placed rim down. So that the dust and debris on the shelving was collected on the wet rims of the cups. And whenever you picked up a cup you could see the wet rim marked it left. These cups should be dry if you‚Äôre going to store them rim down. Drying them rim down traps the moisture inside (causing an unpleasant odor and taste), and damages the shelves, and is altogether unsanitary if the shelves aren‚Äôt even clean. Storing them rim side up would be a better option in this case . They are used often enough for collecting dust to be an argument for storing them rim side down. Sanitary conditions aside, for a vegan/vegetarian place for the only milk option to be whole milk was disappointing. Consider offering milk alternatives.

The food was even more disappointing . My guest ate his omelet , but I good not stomach my food. The cornbread French toast was incredibly dry, even soaking it in the butter and syrup didn‚Äôt revive it. The potatoes tasted fine but they were stale. Since it was the only semi edible thing available to me I picked at that instead of what I ordered. I only managed to eat half of one slice of French toast and didn‚Äôt want to take it home. We came out of our way to go here after seeing it on Instagram. So it was that much more disappointing.

text:
Gaia House Cafe was very nice. The decor is slightly bohemian and very cozy with mismatched chairs and tables.We went on a Tuesday at lunch and got the Gaia Tempeh Ruben and the Banh Mi sandwiches.The coffee was excellent. The staff was very pleasant and the food arrived in good time. The price seemed a little steep for sandwiches but when you get homemade pickles and kraut it makes up for it. I couldn't tell where a good place to park would be, so we parked in the Irish pub reserved area with a risk of towing.

Some things to consider: add a bit more spread on the Banh Mi as it was a little dry; add a few completely vegan options to the menu as many of the entrees are so close but then have cheese; swap out those potato chips for a cup of soup. We'll be back! Keep those homemade fermentations coming!

text: Gaia's open for in house dining and if you use to frequent the old Gaia in East Town you will be familiar with the menu. No meat is served but don't let that stop you.  We had the Paul Collins Cuban and the Jim White.  I also had a freshly, not frozen or sweetened, fruit cup. For some reason I have not been able to get a good fresh fruit cup anywhere I have been for breakfast lately.   All three, excellent, fresh and delicious. Staff was friendly and happy to serve you.  Although the interior doesn't have the same vibe as the old Gaia it has it's own charm and coolness.  Just like any diverse hip cafe people talk to each other, exchange ideas and genuinely are happy to do so while eating exceptionally good food, and for me drinking good coffee.  We had this experience on our first time there. It will be our go to breakfast place.

text:
Enjoyed a nice breakfast today at Gaia. Our waitress was friendly and helpful. Our party of six was seated immediate on a Saturday morning.

Unpretentious, casual, warm interior. Small menu, but nice to have so many vegetarian and vegan options. Good to have the opportunity to try something different, outside the normal brunch fare.

I stuck with what I normally like - eggs & potatoes plus tried a fruit cup. It was a filling portion and cooked well. The potatoes were well seasoned and crispy. I also enjoyed the sourdough bread that came with my meal. The fruit was fresh and seasonal. Coffee was self-service and offered three options, with creamer available at request. I tried the Swiss chocolate brew and liked it a lot. My friend‚Äôs specialty French toasted looked amazing. It has tender sweet saut√©ed apples, cherry sauce, and almonds. Everyone had to try an apple slice - they were really good!

Worth your time and taste buds! Thanks for a good experience!

text: I loved this re-discovery recently! I vowed that if I ever noticed that Gaia Cafe was back  in any way I would maintain patronage as I used to frequent the Cafe when I was a student at Aquinas with friends and family as I maintained a vegetarian diet the majority of my time in attendance there. Thank you for coming back, I love the changes and the maintenance of staple favorites like B.Y.O.B. and Mean Green Burrito. I personally chose the Veggie Stash as recommended by my wonderful hostess (I selected the vegan options for cream cheese and cheese toppings as in recent years I have had to cut dairy out of my diet more fully). I had a lovely experience with the self service water and coffee, enjoying the flow of the community coming in and out of the Cafe as I spent a few hours there working on a few personal and professional goals and trying a new, but also nostalgic, meal. Thank you for being back in the Grand Rapids area!!! üôè

text: First timer- after waiting so long to try- and I loved so much! I wanted to try the stuffed tortilla but weirdly the price on the online menu is $4 cheaper than when you go to actually order it online- a lot of menu items were the same way and I wonder if it's on purpose or if the online menu just needs to be updated? Instead, I got the mean green burrito and I loved how fresh it was- I love love love greens and veggies in a burrito and the tomatillo on top was superb. Howeverrr I really really wished the rice and beans had some more flavor! The whole concept of this burrito is amazing but I was left wanting more when the bulk of the burrito was kind of bland. I would love to try the food again- this time eating in as the space inside was so lovely.

text: My family and I had a fantastic time here! The tickets are a little pricey but it was definitely worth it. The aquariums were lovely with diverse options. There are rental lockers for coats and other accessories for only 5-7 dollars. 10/10 would recommend, especially for families with smaller children!!

text:
4/5 stars because I wasn't super impressed with the overall offerings of live species.
I do love the design of the aquarium and the overall feel when you walk in to the penguin exhibit.

I've been to some great aquariums and I missed the sharks and the sea otters and in Oregon they even had an orca-which happened to be in the movie, Free Willy. Although that was years ago they still have a fantastic exhibit with many more species.

I don't want to be too harsh of a critic, but I was a bit underwhelmed.

I did enjoy the penguin exhibit, the seals and the big sea turtles.

The feel tank had stingrays alone. It was fine, but many feel tanks usually have starfish and other sea urchins. As well as someone commentating.

It was pretty busy and hard to get good pictures, since everybody else is trying to do the same thing.

Aquarium only:

Adults $34
Children over 3. $25
Seniors $32

text:
A must-visit on any trip to Boston. The Aquarium is beautiful and wonderful and all superlatives rolled into one, when it comes to an educational venue.

Turtles, sharks, penguins, seals, eels, jellyfish, rays you can pet...this place never loses its appeal for me. It's mesmerizing and calming and breathtaking in the diversity of natural beauty. A fascinating treasure of New England.

Expect to spend about 1.5-2 hours here if you really want to take it in and learn about the sea life and ecology; 1 hour even if you visit it like an art museum and let the beauty and color wash over your vision.

Tickets were $32 for adults. Gift shop is not big, but the gifts weren't stupidly expensive either.

text:
Overall, this is a really nice aquarium. The primary wow factor is realizing it's virtually all contained in one large atrium with a spiral walkway up the center and an open-air penguin exhibit across the entire bottom of the room. I love penguins, so being able to see them up close and from slightly above with no glass between us was really fascinating. I also loved the seal and sea lion exhibits being outside (yet covered). It adds a more natural feel to the area, which I'm sure the animals enjoy.

I think my only complaint would be that it seems a little small for the ticket price, especially compared to other aquariums across the country. If you purchase a combo pass with other attractions, I'm sure it's a better value. However, all that being said, I was impressed with the number of displays they were able to fit into the space. They made good use of the building's height. I could have probably spent hours watching the center tank - especially the giant sea turtle!
title: New England Aquarium
prompt: A Google Maps review about a aquarium.
completion:
Overall, this is a really nice aquarium. The primary wow factor is realizing it's virtually all contained in one large atrium with a spiral walkway up the center and an open-air penguin exhibit across the entire bottom of the room. I love penguins, so being able to see them up close and from slightly above with no glass between us was really fascinating. I also loved the seal and sea lion exhibits being outside (yet covered). It adds a more natural feel to the area, which I'm sure the animals enjoy.

I think my only complaint would be that it seems a little small for the ticket price, especially compared to other aquariums across the country. If you purchase a combo pass with other attractions, I'm sure it's a better value. However, all that being said, I was impressed with the number of displays they were able to fit into the space. They made good use of the building's height. I could have probably spent hours watching the center tank - especially the giant sea turtle!

text:
Cute aquarium. I‚Äôll lay out the pros and cons to help anyone visiting Boston for a few days decide whether coming here is worth it or not.

Cons:
I wasn‚Äôt a fan of layout of the building itself and the flow between exhibits was kind of awkward. Also, the touch tanks (ie where the sharks and rays are) are right at the entrance and easy to pass by when you enter. If you go into the gift shop before seeing that area you won‚Äôt be able to come back in without showing your ticket again which is kind of annoying.

The ticket price was also kind of expensive for the size of the aquarium ($34) considering there isn‚Äôt that much to see and you‚Äôll probably spend 1.5-2h there at most. The gift shop has only a few items with the cute logo on it and the rest have tacky clip art on them that you wouldn‚Äôt even be able to tell came from this specific aquarium. They should at least put Boston on there or something.

Pros:
Some of the habitats are so creatively curated, from the shape of the glass to the way they planted the vegetation, it‚Äôs all very pleasing to the eye. If you go in the morning you can see the animals being fed which is extra entertaining. They all seem happy especially the turtles who you can see love to be handled by the marine biologists. All staff is friendly and open to answering questions. If you have small kids and came with a stroller they have elevators and a ramp that goes all the way around the building so you can walk around easily without missing anything.

text:
Immediately fell in love with the penguins. And the animals seemed healthy and well cared for. Environments were very clean. Signs throughout were very informative/educational. There was sufficient space (at least on a Thursday in summer) for people to enjoy the aquarium without feeling like they were right on top of each other. We got in late and were actually hoping to grab a snack, but the cafe closed rather early, which was a disappointment. Both beverage machines were out of order, which didn't help matters on a hot day when we needed refreshment. I also thought the price of entry was steep, though we took advantage of the GoCity Boston pass and that helped.
All-in-all I'd recommend.

text: As a fan of the film Next Stop Wonderland, the New England Aquarium was a must-see during my visit to Boston, and it did not disappoint!  The aquarium offers a AAA discount and a university discount. Upon entering, I turned to the left to the sting ray petting experience and shark exhibit.  This was the first of multiple stops where aquarium staff were on hand to share information and answer questions, which was great! I appreciated the washing station, too. The shark exhibit was interactive and engaging.  I could go on about the multiple exhibits and aquariums in the main building, but the jewel of this Aquarium is the enormous, multi-story tank featuring sea turtles, schools of fish, and the scuba divers feeding them.  I suggest calling ahead to find out when the feeding time will be so that you don‚Äôt miss it! See if you can find the small Puffer fish in that large tank; it‚Äôs not easy, but worth seeing that friendly little face! üòä if you turn to the right as you enter the main space, you will find a flashlight attached to the railing that allows you to play with the penguins! They enjoy swimming after that light (which is in a fish shape) just like a cat chases a laser!

text:
We were driving from Portland home to Canada and it was getting quite late so we found the little town of Shelton and it seemed like a convenient place to stop, being only an hour and a half from the Port Angeles Ferry. We googled a place to stay in Shelton and there was a very limited selection so we pulled into a couple and looked for reviews. Let‚Äôs just say they sounded like rat motels from what we read from other travellers. Once we saw there was a Super 8 in Shelton it seemed like the natural place to say as they are typically a decent place to stay being a franchise and all.

We checked in around 8pm and the front desk person was friendly although seemingly bored with his job. The lobby was clean and nice. We had a truck full of purchases that we didn‚Äôt want to leave outside overnight so it was nice that there was an emergency door close to where we parked for bringing all our stuff in. The front desk person did state that the hotel was located in a decent part of town and our stuff would probably be fine.

We paid $70 for the night which was high considering it was a fairly old hotel. It appeared to have been renovated at one point but the work was amateur at best. There were simple things like repairs to the towel bar which were just never painted over. Little touches like that go unnoticed when done but become BIG eyesores when left not finished. The temperature in the room was hard to keep consistent. I had to keep turning on and off the heat because the room likely is not well insulated. The bath towels were small and the caulking around the tub was gross. There was a mini fridge and coffee area, which was a nice touch. We could hear the voices from the other rooms and the aroma of the Mary J was thick in the hallways. We did not stay for the breakfast unfortunately as we were up and out to head for the ferry.

We didn‚Äôt use any of the amenities, we literally just used this hotel to sleep as a crash pad and it did its job. We felt it was pretty clean and mostly quiet and if we had to stay in Shelton again this would definitely be our first stop.

3 solid stars from Doug and Shannon - It wasn't horrible but it was likely the best option in Shelton.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton
prompt: A Google Maps review about a hotel.

Guitar Hero, Fast and Furious, Supercars 3,  2 Bolton Celtics NBA Hoops,  Grab n Win with teddy bears, Prize Time with Basketballs for prizes, PacMan Battle Royale for four players, 2  pool tables, AirHockey,  hurricane simulator Boxer tournament. text: Family loved the zoo experience here! Arrived at opening and easily used our scanner online tickets. Amazing enclosures with up close looks at some of the animals! Great "cool zones" for these 100¬∞+ days. Easy to step inside for a cool off and all restrooms were clean. The "beastro" is way over priced even for a place like this. The snack stations are a bit high too but when it was 105¬∞ today we gladly paid $5.99 for a small Powerade! The 4D movie is a great deal! $24 for 4 and was worth every penny! Stop in for a great show and a good way to beat the heat!  Bring quarts of you want to feed the fish or similar animals since there are pellet vending machines near the water ways. Most of the little vending machines take cards which was convenient for us. The staff were so friendly and didn't hesitate to answer questions!

text: A really beautiful Zoo! They have taken advantage of San Antonio's rocky terrain to create some very well landscaped animal enclosures for all of the animals as well as having trees, flowers, cactuses, and ponds laid out throughout the zoo. It was kind of a cold and rainy day the day we went and a lot of the animals were not having any part of it electing to sleep out of the weather in their enclosures, but we still enjoyed it very much! They have a nice reptile house with lots of snakes, lizards, and turtles. They also have a sea life house that has both fresh water and salt water fish and turtles! There are plenty of refreshment stands spaced out around the grounds as well as restrooms and hand wash stations. There are areas under construction and we went in through the Blue entrance, I believe the regular entrance might be the orange entrance, but it was closed. They also have a train station that has a scaled down train to take you on a nice ride around the zoo and Breckenridge Park!

text: Very good Zoo to keep kids amused... The Zoo opens at 12pm to 9pm. The holiday lights are really cool after dark time. The kiddie park is right next to main Zoo which has many kids rides, it's a lot fun for kids. The 15 min train ride is fun as well. The train is running for every 20 mins. The parking is away from main Zoo entrance which is mis leading. Plan for a whole day since the Zoo is big and needs lot of walking. Please bring your kids stroller so you don't end up carry your kids.. there is much restaurants inside, not sure if put side food is allowed or not. Every food store has a long line, so anticipate that. I recommend to buy tickets online since the entrance was very busy, also online has good deals which I loved it. Go for a fun filled day activity with your kids, you won't be disappointed.

text:
I really like this zoo. I enjoyed it so much that I bought an annual pass for my family. There are a lot of different animals to see and appreciate. Fun areas for the kids and lots of "cool zone" areas to cool off in the Texas heat.

I wish that the membership plan was a bit more all inclusive. The lowest tier membership that I have doesn't allow you to ride rides or feed some of the animals without paying an additional fee.

Other than that, though, it's a fun place to spend an hour or two on a weekend.

text: We've been season pass holders for many years, and I just want to say that I appreciate that the zoo tries really hard to have engaging events each month. There are some sections with minimal shade,  so in Texas,  that means it can get REALLY HOT. I wish there were misting fans or little shaded canopies, especially in places where there are tables... but the employees are helpful, the newly refurbished kids area (as of 3/25 it still has some construction in that area) is fun. I just wish there were more seating places for parents. My daughter is going on 8, and has been going since she was just a baby... overall,  it's a great place for families, especially seeing and knowing our zoo is one of the leading zoos for endangered birds. Just bring lots of water, hats, parasols, and go early or late- just avoid the heat of the day.  (Pics taken from recent butterfly and pollinators event 3/25/23)

text:
Everything from start to finish was fantastic! The onion soup was flavorful and did not need the Gruy√®re cheese, but the cheese made it better. Perfect for a cold winter night! The steak tartare was also flavored well with peppers and the perfect ratio to the sauce. The chips made it even better. The duck breast matched well with the parsnip pur√©e and was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The flavor profile had a gamier edge. The portion sizes were generous, and there were extra duck pieces mixed in with the vegetables. The cocktails were a delight: my old fashioned had a clear, custom cut ice cube that added to the aesthetic charm. The drink tasted better over time as the ice melted.

One of the owners, John, was so friendly; he came to check on our table to see how we were doing. I had a wonderful experience and will definitely come back!

text: We had a wonderful experience at Westchester for lunch! The decor is beautiful and the ‚Äúvibe‚Äù inside is welcoming and cozy but also hip. He even sent our server, Olivia, out to double check that multi grain bread was ok for the grilled cheese. Olivia was a wonderful server as well and knew everything about the menu, and the owner was there at the host stand greeting people as they came in. There was a big table of women having a fun lunch and the bar was full of groups of men hanging out as well. I am born and raised in Chesterfield and it‚Äôs totally unique and awesome for the area. I highly recommend it and we will be back very soon! Probably for dinner‚Ä¶without the kids üòÇ ‚ù§Ô∏è

text: My son took me on a trip to Savannah for my birthday. I can't begin to even explain how impressed I was with Hyatt Regency Savannah. When you pull up...valet and busboy. Check-in was seamless. The Christmas decor was gorgeous! Not tacky...very tasteful. The gym is the best gym I've seen in a hotel. The indoor heated pool was huge, and very clean. We had it to ourselves for nearly two hours. The room was immaculate! I e worked in the hotel industry...the housekeepers there don't skip any steps. I appreciate that. Within walking distance (some right across the street) were souvenir shops, breweries, pubs, restaurants... everything you need! Our view was a gorgeous clock tower on city hall. Sounds odd...but it was really beautiful. When we go back, we will be staying at Hyatt again. Well worth the price!

text: My wife and I had a very nice stop over here while traveling. The hotel has recently been updated and it's very well done. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. We had a river view room which was really nice. Watching the cargo ships go past while fully loaded is a neat thing as well as the rest of the boats doing their thing. This hotel is also right in the middle of everything happening on River Street. VERY convenient location when walking the shops and restaurants while enjoying the river front. This hotel should be highly considered when planning a trip to Savannah.

text:
Spent 3 nights here. It was a decent stay but due to the Covid restrictions we really couldn't take advantage of what the hotel offered. No room service which was disappointing.

Rooms were good sized, beds were comfortable although the pillows left a lot to be desired. Good water pressure in the shower but the bathroom products were a little boring. Good WiFi strength in the room.

The real value in this hotel is the location. It's right in the middle of all the action and walking distance to everything a person would need in Savannah.

We are looking forward to staying at this Hyatt again soon.

text: Would have lived to rate this hotel 5 stars, but the valet service was not up to par. The valet staff were friendly, but the processes seem to be broken or are not being managed. Views from the roof garden and also the sun deck are worth the visit - even better that they are not super busy!

text:
Great location.  Inadequate housekeeping for a hotel of that standard and price.  A big pile of hair, yes indeed a pile, had been left in the shower drain.  Made me wonder if they had cleaned the bathroom at all.  Additionally, the main widow was completely smudged as if someone had applied a greasy face onto it.  We mentioned both issues to the front desk and the drain was cleaned up but not the window.  I ended up cleaning the window with a towel.  Another disappointment was the food options... Overpriced 7-inch pizzas for $16 per person, which fortunately tasted good, but $50 for 2 small pizzas and 2 beers... That's ridiculous.
Follow-up from management: received a reply that seemed like a "cookie cutter" apology.  I am attaching a picture of the note from housekeeping that was left in our room, I am assuming in hope of tips. My advice: focus on cleaning and skip the ridiculous notes.

I will stay again when we come back.

text:
I've stayed at numerous Hyatt Regencys throughout the world. I've never stayed at such a filthy Hyatt. Far from the one in Bangkok.
Throughout the room you see long-term grime, dried unknown fluids on the floors, doors, doorknobs, cabinets, and counters!!
It's so obvious that nobody has deeply cleaned this room for months if not longer. The room smelled exactly like the damp scent I've experienced while staying on offshore fishing boats.
The soap dish is broken and sharp.
My colleague has empty beer bottles on the top shelf in her closet. Toothpaste on the bathroom walls near the mirror. The mirror is filthy as are the grimy glass shower doors.
There's pink mildew growing all over the shower tiles. The towels are the worst. Super thin and non-absorbent. The pillows are terrible and the mattress is too firm. The blanket was so thin it didn't feel luxurious in any way. Lastly, there was some brown liquid dried on the toilet lid.
Here for a conference and the bathrooms in the hall downstairs were equally dirty.

text:
We stayed for an overnight stay this past weekend and had a wonderful time! We were in a poolside room which had a door right into the indoor pool. This was so nice to be able to walk right out, swim, and head right back into our room. The room was clean and comfortable and had plenty of space. The outdoor pool is a good size and has plenty of seating available. We used the mobile app for check-in, check-out, and the key to our room which worked great and it was so nice to not have to go to the front desk for anything.

We explored the hotel and the event rooms were so beautiful. The location isn't directly near much, but it is pretty close to downtown Lancaster which had some great restaurants and shopping.

The main issue I think worth noting is that the wifi in the hotel, at least in our room, was basically unusable. We had to use mobile data to use the internet and the app for our room key. If you need internet to do any work while you're there I would say it isn't going to happen. Overall our stay was great and we'll definitely consider going back!

text:
Overall, we had a good stay. Came here with my sisters, mother, and nieces for a girls night out. The room was clean and comfortable but a bit dated. Staff were friendly and helpful during our stay.

The pool was heated, but it was still cold in my opinion. They ran out of towels when I had arrived to the pool so I had to wait until I was ready to leave and they had just restocked the towels. The playground was small, but nice. The basketball court was also nice. The table tennis could have been maintained better, the net was broken so was the 1 paddle that was at the table. While I was there the restaurant was closed for renovations. So were unable to get room service despite the front desk telling me the other restaurant was opened, but I was unable to get connected to that restaurant.

Other than the few minor hiccups, we enjoyed our stay, I do feel the resort was overpriced based on what was offered.

text: Been coming here for years, beautiful hotel, great salt water indoor pool & spa. Heated outdoor pool open until end of October. Also outside has small playground, basketball, pool table, ping pong table, shuffle board & bocce. Reasons for 3 stars, 1. had absolutely no WiFi the entire 4 days their in our room. It was located poolside by the indoor pool. WiFi worked outside of room & in lobby though. Spoke to front desk twice, & they said they didn‚Äôt need to come to the b/c router was outside of room. Was texting with someone & they gave me the password to another WiFi, but that didn‚Äôt work in the room. 2. Weddings all weekend so very hard to get a parking spot at night. Rooms lack USB ports to charge devices. No more free coffee in lobby. Gave a card now for towels, 1 towel per card, if you don‚Äôt turn card back in $25 charge, see pic. Hotel is $200 -$300 or more a night depending on when you go. 10-15 minute drive to Route 30, where all the stores & activities are.

text:
We checked in today and so far this place has exceeded our expectations. Staff has been incredibly friendly and helpful. We checked into on of the suites snd recived a text from. The concierges to help us with anything we needed. We texted them a few times to get some information and they were very prompt, helpful and really nice. The room is wonderful, very clean  and modern. See pics. Were going to us the heated pool , hot tub and will try the on site restaurant, will update our review post.
Update, we did goto the indoor pool and it was enchanting. Indoor heated pool was great. You get cards for towel service when you check in and get a fresh towel when you arrive to the pool. The jacuzzi was corded off due to maintenance. While that was dissapointing for our evening I greatly appreciated thier concern for guests safety.
We also had dinner at the restaurant and that was incredible. They have this seafood dish with a tomato broth that was divine. Everyone in our party raved about thier food.
Breakfast, we would advise to skip the buffet, it was not up to the rest of the standards. Pastries were days old, the hot fares were mediocre.  The fruit was nice but that was not worth the price. So I would suggest breakfast offsite and there close places to choose from.
Breakfast aside this place us great and we'll worth the price, we loved our stay.

text:
I went to an event that offering a free meal by a mattress salesman.
I personally wanted one of the lobster dinners they were advertising so I ordered it after the event was over.
It looked like the lobsters were old, sat out all day then microwaved. A $50/$60 tasteless plate. I sent it back and kept the free meal. That free meal was also tasteless. No seasoning on Anything.
That was an event offered there for several days.
That salesman had to have spent thousands!
My suggestion to him, find another restaurant if he ever came back to Pittsburgh. The best thing offered at Red Lobster that day was the bed because I bought one!!
This is what I got versus what they advertised

text: My Family & I Visited "RED LOBSTER" on McKnight Road for the 1st Time yesterday (6-10-18). We took My Wife there for Her BIRTHDAY & We TOTALLY Enjoyed Our lunch. It was a Very DELICIOUS & DOWNRIGHT Enjoyable Experience. Our Grown Children & their Spouses & Our 4 Grandkids really ENJOYED what they ordered & even sampled other Family Members dishes. Our Server was a VERY NICE & HELPFUL Gentleman by the Name of DONALD. He took a few minutes to show us the MENU & He even made a suggestion or two in case We couldn't decide what We wanted. The Menu choices were MASSIVE & looked very TASTY in the pictures, Which made My choice on what to choose to EAT more EXHAUSTING. My Wife's & My 1st Visit to "RED LOBSTER" Won't be Our last bc We were BOTH very IMPRESSED w/ Our Server DONALD & Our LUNCH was so "DAMNED DELICIOUS" & the INSIDE DECOR was Very Impressive & Warm. Menu Prices are VERY COMPARABLE & REASONABLE too. I CAN'T tell You what We ALL ordered for lunch, but I CAN tell You that EVERYONE left w/ a HAPPY & FULL Stomach.

text:
This place doesn‚Äôt look like much when you pull up, but once inside you can tell that they take pride in this hotel.
Everything in the lobby was very clean, neat and orderly. It looked like this place had been remodeled recently.
The breakfast and sitting area are located right off of the main entrance across from the lobby.
It too was very clean and neat.
I stopped here for one night on my return trip home from Florida.
I always choose a Best Western because the rooms are very clean, they give you complimentary toiletries, blow dryer, iron and ironing board, a coffee pot and free coffee in your room. You also get a refrigerator and microwave in your room and free WiFi.
I always try to get a king size bedroom. The beds are super comfortable, and I‚Äôm able to get a good nights sleep.
With my room came with a complimentary breakfast. This is standard with most Best Westerns.
This Smithville Best Western has an indoor pool which is permanently closed and a gym. I did not use them.
For breakfast they serve scrambled eggs, ham or bacon, grits, homemade waffles, that you make yourself. Cold cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, biscuits and sausage gravy, bagels, toast, muffins, pastries, coffee, tea, juices, or milk. You can have as much as you want. The breakfast is constantly replenished by a sweet older lady.
Checkin was very easy. The front desk staff was extremely nice, and made some recommendations when we asked. They have a free parking lot.
This hotel is located off I-95, this low-key hotel is an 8-minute walk from shopping at Carolina Premium Outlets and 2 miles from the Ava Gardner Museum. The prices were reasonable for this hotel.
I would definitely stay here again.
