text: This review is about the hotel itself. Big pluses it's location (less than 40 minutes drive from DC) and direct connection to the casino and just 3 minutes walk to the center of the shopping mall. The room decor is pretty nice, they are clean and have ample of amenities (supplemental coffee, towels and so on). The staff is attentive (some reviews mentioned that staff were rude - nothing like that here). Check in and check out was a breeze. So, why 4 stars? I get used to having minibar - here a fridge but no drinks. Also a little bit late check in time - past 3PM. Overall it was a darn good time. And finally couple technical details - hotel charges around $15 resort fee (worth it - the spa is nice) and it's $150 hold for accidental fee (some people counted it as "erroneous charge".

text:
My wife and I stopped here for lunch following a trip to Chriskindlemart.

We were quickly greeted by the hostess and or waitress Kim came over to us to take our order relatively quickly. She greeted us with a smile in a very friendly manner.

We both ordered the strawberry lemonade which is a great thirst quencher. For appetizers,  we shared the crab dip and brown butter buffalo wings which were delicious.

For meals, my wife had the crab cakes with brussel sprouts and the bacon twice baked potato. She said the crab cakes were very good but said the brussel sprouts,  although extremely tasty and flavorful,  were not fully cooked and were somewhat hard. She also said the twice baked potato filling was very good, but the skin of the potato was very hard and overcooked.

I had the butter garlic strip steak medium well with the broccoli, potato wedges and the stuffed potato.

The steak was served already sliced, and although not a huge problem, not something that I prefer. It was slightly over cooked. To me, medium well it's slightly pink in the center (serving temp around 160*) but it was cooked well done. Also, the menu says roasted garlic and herb butter. I didn't sense any butter on it and it came with quartered garlic on top. The wedges were very tasty and seasoned nicely as was the stuffed potato.

For dessert we had the funnel cake fried Oreo's which was delicious!

The presentation of all the food was exceptional. The cleanliness of the restaurant was superb. There wasn't a time when we didn't see someone cleaning.

Lastly, the food was not very expensive for the portions.

Service - 10
Cleanliness - 10
Speed - 9
Quality - 8
Value - 10

Overall dining experience - 9.4

text:
Very Disappointed with their rooms and cleaning service.
$500 for a room for 1 night.
Immediately upon walking into the room we were greeted by cigerett smoke stench. A broken door card reader cover, candle wax on the bathroom floor. And hair in the shower. We stayed without complaining.....with the exception of notifying the front desk of the horrible  cigerett smoke smell, just because i wasn't going to get charged a cleaning fee for something that wasn't us. It was our first night out together in a long time so we weren't going to let that ruin our evening.......as we had a blast at the casino and restaurants. When I brought it to the managements attention upon check out, I was offered an apology.
But in closing......I learned we'll stay somewhere else from now on!

text:
Small casino compared to other ones I‚Äôve been to (Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods). We stayed for a night in the Center Suite as a mini getaway from home.

They allowed us to check-in early, which was nice, especially since my husband wanted to take my toddler to the pool. Toddler had fun in the pool, but besides that there wasn‚Äôt much to do for the little one.
Ate dinner at one of the restaurants on the casino floor and then spent rest of the evening in the room watching tv (not much option). Ordered room service for breakfast the next day before we went home. There was nothing special about it and coffee had a horrible cleaning supply taste to it. Pretty expensive especially since 18% gratuity was included in the room service bill

For those planning to visit with underaged kids, you will need to be escorted at all times in the casino area even if you are just heading to the restaurant inside.

I would probably come again once more just so my toddler could use the pool and I also heard good things about the spa

text: The rooms are very modern and clean. There is a very nice hiking trail across the road sponsored by the hotel. A few things annoyed me. The casino allows smoking on the casino floor. The smell permeates into the restaurants, the gym and the hotel lobby.  In the room the heating/ventilation system sounds like a car ending. The bathroom fan is loud and does not have an off switch. The pool closes at 8 pm. There is nothing to do in the evening except gambling or drinking at the tiny quiet bar or the very loud casino floor bar.

text:
Got an awesome deal from Groupon for 1 night. We arrived at 6pm, free valet, were quickly checked in, and down enjoying the pool by 7pm where we wound down with a drink and a swim. Afterwards we showered, had some delicious appetizers at Guy Fieri‚Äôs then hit the casino floor  for a few hours before calling it a night. The beds are so comfy I didn‚Äôt feel my partner move all night. We just woke up and had an amazing breakfast at GF‚Äôs and are packing up before heading back down to enjoy the pool for a couple more hours before we hit the road for our next destination.
Few complaints: the parking. Your options are valet and waiting or self-parking outside the casino and making the trek up to your room. It is a bit slow moving process if you choose valet. Also, the mini fridges are packed with items that will get charged to your room if removed. They don‚Äôt leave you any space for you own items that need to be refrigerated.
Overall and for the deal we got, we are very pleased.

text: I‚Äôve been renting from Yankee for more than a decade and I don‚Äôt know which is better - the quality of the boats or the service. text:
After a few years of renting boats from a local competitor that always had issues (non existent bimini, broken gas gauge, engine that was leaking gas, dirty and old boats, etc), i decided to try a new rental place.

I rented the 18 foot 150hp Bowrider.  There were no massive issues like before.  The boat was clean, fast, and fun.  The stereo didn't work but we had a wireless water proof speaker for this anyways.  We rented for 3 days and came back once for a fuel up in between.

The only downside was that we hit an underwater log in the middle of the lake.  They showed me the damage to the skeg and as I had taken a pic of the prop/skeg before the rental, it was undeniable.  Got hit with a $350 charge for repair, but I can't blame Yankee as this is part of the risk of boating.

I will be renting from Yankee from now on.

text: Was there over Valentine's weekend. Snowed aprox 2ft. The snow was expected, the amount not so much. The staff were busy each day with a tractor, snow blower and shovel keeping it as clear as possible. Obviously it was impossible to take advantage of much of the amenities like the pool, playground etc. The gift shop was nice and had some items we purchased. Ate one meal from the bar/cafe as take out due to covid restrictions and outside seating was a bit cold, although they did have several heaters out. The cabin, 5B was clean, warm and romantic. On Valentine's Day a staff member brought a rose and a card to our room. Nice touch folks! I will recommend the Lone Fir to friends. Thank you for working so hard to make our experience a great one under such trying times, restrictions, and conditions all around.

text:
The hotel phone and online reservation staff, parking lot, and conference staff are disconnected and disjointed.

I WOULD NOT recommend this place for a conference just based on trying to reserve a room and set up for conferences.

The front desk folks are nice and polite.

I COULD NOT stay at the hotel because they would answer the phone and transferred me to a number that would just disconnect you and emails go unanswered or vague responses with no answers to your questions.

They seem to be focused on valet services and conference fees but making vendors at conferences jump through hoops. You must leave keys with the valet to unload and you can't use the side doors because it bypasses the valet.

They respond with the ability to ignore your issues with short useless comments.

text:
I stayed here for the NENA conference last year, and I'd heard only negative things about the hotel.  I'm happy to say they were wrong!

The hotel underwent a renovation at some point in the last few years so the rooms are more modern.  From what my co-worker said it "used to look like a dump".  There are some issues with quality of the rooms where it looks like a flipper did them.  An example is the shower doors where they will slide open on their own.  My room as well as my co-worker had this issue.

The pool is very large with a nice bar and a window to order food and drinks from while outside.  There is also a clear walking path to the beach.  There is an inside and outside pool area.  The inside area has a hot tub and a little area for swimming inside (it's connected to the main pool, so if it storms - you'll need to get out).  The inside area is slippery, so watch your footing and DO NOT LET YOUR KIDS RUN.  The main large pool has a walk over bridge and a gazebo where live music was played every day I was there.

If you want food, they have two restaurants that serve dinner (one casual and one fancy), but they are a little pricey.  The fancier option you'll need to make a reservation for as they are small and don't have space for walk ins.  There is also a little cafe that is open in the mornings with coffee and muffins.

text:
I was so impressed with Perdido Beach Resort at our recent conference. All of the staff went above and beyond to meet our needs and facilitate the conference. Front desk staff,  catering/restaurant staff, maid service staff were all excellent.  My hotel room was beautiful, clean and comfortable.  The complimentary valet parking was so appreciated upon arrival! The food at all meals was wonderful.  The lobby, with live music in the evenings, was such a pleasure.
Looking forward to returning.
One suggestion I would make is to get rid of the plastic table attached to the balcony railing in the ocean-front rooms. It obscures the view - not so much when you're standing in the doorway, but when you're seated in the room, it really blocks the view. And, while I see the benefit of the bar-height stools on the balcony, for enhanced viewing while on the balcony, they are very uncomfortable after about 5 minutes.  I have a bad back.  I called the desk to request a regular height chair for the balcony, but none were available.  I ended up buying a chair to use on the balcony - left it in the room, as I didn't have room to take it with me.  If you're planning to replace the rest of the balcony chairs with the plastic bar table and bar stool chairs, please reconsider - maybe offer both, or have some regular chairs available, upon request. If you've already committed to installing the balcony bar table, please consider moving it to the edge of the balcony so it doesn't obstruct the view so much from within the room. One small suggestion in a wonderful stay.
There was a very long wait (45 minutes) on the phone to make a reservation. We had to phone in to get the conference rate. Once I reached a reservationist, everything was great.
The live music in the lobby was most memorable. It just made me happy every time I walked through. The musician did an excellent job.

text: Very economical. This sampler I got had 4 different things on it using a big plate. For $3 more, you get a salad and drink. All said and done, about $12 for everything, and it was a ton of food. Service was great. Food was prepared quickly, very friendly people, and attentive to check up on you. Bread sticks (when dining in) are unlimited, and they come hot and fresh, buttered and seasoned with garlic. They are super soft and fluffy. Honestly, I rate their breadsticks above Olive Gardens. They are wonderful. Reasons why I‚Äôm not going with 5 stars, is nothing that this location has control over. It‚Äôs not a complaint of the individual location itself. First issue is, I felt the Alfredo sauce was very bland. I‚Äôve had stuff out of a jar at home that beats it. Secondly, the amount of sauce (all 3 pastas had the same issue) they put on is very little compared to the noodles you get. My feeling is, I can buy a pound of uncooked noodles for $1 at the store. After they absorb the water, you‚Äôve got 2lbs of noodles for $1. Commercially, they buy them much cheaper than that even. Noodles are incredibly cheap. Yet, you‚Äôre not really given enough sauce for them. Since pasta is so cheap, you‚Äôd think they could afford another 50 cents of sauce. The picture makes it look ok because it‚Äôs all on the top. It certainly looks like a decent amount of sauce. But you can‚Äôt see the noodle to sauce ratio. Also, I assume they have a pre-specified ladle size they are told to use. However, mix things up (or eat the top portion), and you‚Äôll quickly find yourself eating plain noodles. Again, I‚Äôm sure this is a corporate thing, and not location specific, but you‚Äôre reading my review because you want an honest review, right? So, I‚Äôm going to tell my experience as it was. Over all, I‚Äôm giving it 4 stars still, as service is good, breadsticks are wonderful, and food was pretty good, aside from the lack of sauce. Go in there prepared with this info, and see what you think. And remember, those wonderful breadsticks... they are unlimited. They will keep bringing more if you want. And, you‚Äôll likely want them to.

text: I've eaten there, and now I work there. So I get to see the food "behind the scenes". Most, if not all, is homemade in the sense that whoever the cook is, they will cook it their own way with their own ingredients like they would in their own home. So you get to try the same food about 4 to 5 different ways which I think is pretty awesome. The cooks take allergy warnings very seriously. The owners come in pretty much every day to make sure we dont stray off of the path that they made to build this restaurant and its food upon. We have SO many return customers that when they're off work they will hang out with us from open to close. We strive to be extra friendly and helpful! And our MANY return customers can verify.  We have 2 flat screens to watch your sports on or for your child to watch cartoons so you can eat with some peace (lol). Our food is great tasting. Certain waitresses will buy 4 to 5 bowls of homemade cream of crab soup to take home for the night. As an example. So if we trust the food enough to eat it AND buy it in bulk, I'm sure you will love your dinner! Since I started working 1 month ago, I have yet to hear not even one complaint. If I work somewhere that's not all that good, I'm not afraid to say so. So I promise I'm not on here because anyone told me to, or to try to gain more customers etc. I simply rated it because my phone noticed how often I come here and asked me to review it LOL. Dont be afraid to give it a try. The portions range from "good size for the money" to "Massive"! We are located inside the Laurel De Truck Stop/gas station with the Hardees hooked to it. Come say hello if you've seen this review and I happen to be worki g when you come in! My name is Alyssa & I cant wait to meet yall!

completion: Fun for the whole family, from bouncing to some arcade games it is definitely a place to visit. The only downside is the no food options. They have beverages and some snacks but no food. You do have some options in the plaza outside.

text: So here's the deal.  The first time I ate at this spot was last month I got the steak hoagie and my bf got the BBQ chicken hoagie.  Both were amazing.  Tonight, we both decided to try the burgers.  I'm only going to give the burgers a 2 out of 5.  The bun was double the size of the burger. The burger was dry, and the bottom of the burger was hard as if it was precooked and sitting. They didn't even ask or include any veggies for the burger.  No lettuce. No tomatoes.  No onions, and I paid 13 bux for this burger. Next, you definitely have to work on a different way of delivering the fries.  They get soggie in plastic containers.  Some places use paper bags.  Just a thought.

text:
If you have a healthy appetite you gotta check out BullDawg's Burgers....and ask for Mike....who happens to be the Owner.

Mike is very personable and friendly he greeted me as soon as I walked in the door.....in other words he made me feel welcomed immediately and things only got better from there!

The food...all I can say is....OH MY GOODNESS!!!!! I ordered a chocolate shake (no whipped cream  HUMONGOUS BURGER and loaded fries and I was in delicious food heaven!!!

If you are located in Pittsburgh or ever find yourself visiting Pittsburgh make a bee line to BullDawg's Burgers and ask for Mike.......tell him The Disabled Vet sent ya'!!!!!!!

100% guarantee you won't leave hungry!

text:
Pretty decent little sandwich shop. They have hoagies, cheesesteaks, burgers, wings, and almost any other American type food. Tonight, I saw they had a great deal on Uber Eats offering buy 1 get one 1 free on select items. I decided to try the classic Philly cheesesteak, which also came with their hand cut fries (you also have the option of substituting chicken for steak).

The cheesesteak was about $12.50 each, which I think is an okay price. Portion size is decent too, not too big nor too small. I will say that there was quite a lot of bread in comparison to the meat, cheese, and vegetables. I believe the bun was too thick. The steak itself was pretty flavorful and had a good texture. They use an adequate amount of cheese. Good amount of mushrooms, and each mushroom is quite big, but they do have a slight canned flavor.

The fries were just okay. Quality probably declined due to them being in the car for delivery. Still, they were not bad, and definitely nice to get fries for free. As usual, I would have wanted a bit more salt or pepper, and they were a bit limp.

All in all, not a bad spot for a sandwich, wings, or other classic American fare. The cheesesteak was still enjoyable, just nothing special. I do appreciate the deal they had going on with Uber Eats, though.

text: Great little zoo with well kept animals. The zoo is really well kept and they have a really good variety of animals. Their cages were clean and they all seemed happy and well-fed. The whole zoo isn't very big but definitely worth the price. The customer service is what needs a little work. Some of the employees were great and very friendly while others seemed to be bothered by questions. I also didn't like that there was only one very small restroom in the very beginning. But, overall a great ace to visit for a few hours. Also, as everyone has noted the free castle playground in the front is a major plus. The kids loved running around in it after the zoo visit.

completion: Food was great, wait wasn't long, great service!

text: First time eating here and the food is great, I had the mixed fajitas and the steak and chicken was so tender and flavorful, the frozen margaritas are delicious, the kids tenders were fresh and tasted great, I'll definitely be back here to dine or just for drinks, atmosphere is cool as well, very clean and spacious restaurant.
